This event is being hosted by <a>Dave Cervini's New York Social Network </a>and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions contact the event organizer [masked].

See the Highline in a totally different way as the sun sets and with the spring cutback which exposes a lot of what is covered during the summer.  You will also have a chance to check out the planets and stars through the telescopes of the Amateur Astronomers Association!  Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day!  The Highline is New York’s most popular attraction! The Highline is an elevated freight train trestle that operated in NYC from the 1930’s to the 1980’s. After years of neglect The Friends of The Highline have saved the structure and transformed it into a beautiful park featuring many of the elements from its’ rich history! Your tour guide will share the history of the highline and the surrounding neighborhoods and show you amazing photo’s from before the trestle was built, while it was in operation and what it looked like while abandoned.

Join us for a fun evening socializing and learning.  Following the tour the group will go out for food and drinks. $15 includes the tour only.

What to Wear: Dress casual/business casual. Wear comfortable shoes

What to Bring: A camera, a bottle of water for the walk and your sense of adventure!

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own.

What to Expect: 10-20 fun and friendly people who are looking to make new friends and learn a little about the city.

The group will meet at the bar at The Death Avenue Cafe on 10th and 28th from 6:30-7pm (Come closer to 6:30pm if you wish to have a pre-tour cocktail or nosh) we will end at Gansevoort street. Following the tour the group will likely go out for food and drink. Tour duration approx: 90 minutes.

Please bring exact change if possible: $15

In case of poor weather we will send updates prior to the tour
results.name: NY Tours For New Yorker's Sunset Stargazing Highline History Tour

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

When you RSVP, please post your pace time and/or training run distance for the day.
results.name: Central Park Training Run

results.description:
Programming Roombas with Ruby with Eric Wood

After a long day of writing web apps sometimes it's nice to drop down to a lower level and twiddle some real bits around. In this talk we'll learn the basics of bit twiddling and write some raw Ruby code to control the infamous iRobot Roomba™ robotic vacuum cleaner! Eric is a displaced Austinite trying to make it as a web dev in The Big Apple.

Drawing with the HTML5 Canvas with Jennifer Sardinia

This presentation will cover the fundamentals and challenges of implementing an HTML5 canvas prototype to create a basic drawing application. Jennifer is a recent Flatiron School graduate with a background in education and healthcare. 

The Infrastructure That Powers RubyGems.org and Bundler with Sam Kottler

RubyGems.org has served over 5 billion gems to user of RubyGems and Bundler since it was created in 2009. This talk will include a brief history of the history of RubyGems.org, as well as the dependency resolution, gem installation, and CDN-backed binary distribution systems which power its modern incantation. Finally, there will be a brief portion about where Bundler and RubyGems.org are headed and how interested folks can get involved. Sam Kottler is a platform engineer at DigitalOcean, where he manages hardware and systems design across their global fleet. He's a committer to Bundler, RubyGems, Ansible, CentOS, Puppet, and several other prominent open source projects. Sam formerly worked in the virtualization R&D group at Red Hat and was an early engineer at Venmo.
results.name: Roombas, Rubygems, and the HTML5 Canvas

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


 

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

 

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

 

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

 

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:50 pm, Thu. 11 am – 12 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

 

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
Join Marcos Salazar, Co-founder and Executive Director of Be Social Change, on Tuesday, June 9th for Intro to Social Entrepreneurship: Opportunities, Challenges and Trends.

===========================================

This is a paid class - be sure to purchase your ticket here: 

http://bit.ly/SocEntJun10

===========================================


Social entrepreneurship is a rapidly evolving field that leverages entrepreneurship principles towards solving social and environmental problems. It represents a new lens through which individuals and organizations around the world are creating meaningful and sustainable change. The term itself has attracted an increasing amount of talent, resources, and attention, however, social entrepreneurship is at the beginning stages of its growth and is often misunderstood.

This Be Social Change class draws upon the latest social entrepreneurship research as well as the insights and lessons learned from Marcos building out the Be Social Change community to help define and clarify what social entrepreneurship means, how it is practiced, and what you can do to participate within this movement. The class will illuminate how a generation of change makers is exploring and developing new approaches and business models to address the world’s most critical challenges.

* Doors open at 6:45, class starts at 7:00 sharp *

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

An overall understanding of the social entrepreneurship ecosystemThe difference between entrepreneurship vs. social entrepreneurshipNew types of organizations and business models used to create social changeOpportunities and challenges for the future of social entrepreneurship

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

Anyone who wants to learn more about the latest in social entrepreneurship and how it is being used to create social change around the worldYou have an idea for a project, organization or business and want to learn how other change makers have brought their ideas to lifeYou want to become part of a community using entrepreneurship as a vehicle for creating bold, innovative social impact


INSTRUCTOR BIO

Marcos Salazar (@marcossalazar) is a social entrepreneur, career + life coach, consultant, speaker, and community builder. His passion is working with professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives to help them pursue work they are passionate about, build authentic personal brands, become financially successful, and create lives that make the world a better place. He does this through 1-on-1 coaching, nonprofit and businesses consulting, and on a larger scale as Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change where he’s built the largest social impact community and professional development hub in New York City. Marcos earned a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College as well as a Masters in Organizational Management and an Executive Leadership Coaching certificate from The George Washington University. Marcos is a board member of the Young Professionals Nonprofit Network and an American Express Leadership Academy Fellow. You can learn more about him at www.MarcosSalazar.com.   

SPACE PARTNER 

The Bard MBA (@BardMBA) in Sustainability is one of a select few graduate programs globally that fully integrates sustainability into a core business curriculum. At Bard, students work in collaborative teams learning how to build businesses and not-for-profit organizations that combine economic, environmental, and social objectives into an integrated bottom line that creates not only healthier businesses, but also a more sustainable world. Graduates of the Bard MBA will transform existing companies, start their own, and pioneer a new paradigm of doing business that meets human needs, protects and restores the Earth's systems, and treats all stakeholders with justice and respect.

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change
results.name: BSC Class: Intro to Social Entrepreneurship- Opportunities, Challenges & Trends

results.description:
Join us for a beautiful summer evening in Hoboken, mostly by the Hudson River. But first we'll get a delicious and inexpensive dinner at world-famous Mamoun's Falafel.

The world-famous original Mamoun's on Macdougal St. in Greenwich Village

Mamoun's Falafel is impossibly good and impossibly cheap. Longtime New Yorkers can tell you about the continual line streaming out of the place, at any time of day or night, from their original location on Macdougal Street in Greenwich Village. Founded in 1971 and featured in the book 1,000 Places To See Before You Die, it is New York's original falafel restaurant.

Hoboken Mamoun's!

But did you know there are five other locations? (In the East Village, Hoboken, New Brunswick, New Haven and Princeton. I've been to them all. :) And in my considered opinion, the non-New York locations are even better than the original. Why? Larger menus (with more menu items) and more-and-better seating space.

One item I particularly love that is unavailable in the New York locations is their "Pickles" (pickles, pickled turnips and olives) for $1.25. It's my favorite pickled dish anywhere in the world, and it's a perfect accompaniment.

Of course, what made Mamoun's a New York legend was their $2 falafel sandwiches (now $3.50). These are served to eager Macdougal Street patrons (who make a line out the door day and night). Mamoun's of course has the Middle Eastern standards: hummus, baba ghanouj, tabouli, plus lentil soup (so delicious!), grape leaves (my favorite grape leaves), spinach pie -- all perfectly made and all so inexpensive! Their side order of hummus, served with plentiful "pita ends", is just about a meal in itself and is only $2.00!

I love tamarind drinks - tamarind seed, sugar and water. They can be hard to find, but I have tasted several. Mamoun's is the best, and it's $1.85. Also $1.85: mint lemonade, mango juice, Mamoun's spiced tea (hot or cold).

Vegan & Vegetarian Warning: Mamoun's serves meat. But they seem to be excellent at keeping and cooking their meat dishes separately. Generally speaking, all the dishes that seem like they should be vegan are vegan. But if you are a vegan, just double-check the vegan-ness of your order with the person you order from.

While this Hoboken location has sit-down tables, there is no waiter service. You order your food at the back of the restaurant, and then bring it yourself to your own table. Mention to the person who takes your order any dietary requirements you have -- and in particular that you are a vegetarian or vegan.

Hoboken is known and loved for its outstanding views of the Hudson River and New York City. Walking along the Hudson in Hoboken is a summertime pleasure not-to-be-missed.  Our group will be strolling beside the Hudson River before and after Stop Two on our itinerary, The W Hotel Hoboken (itself on the Hudson).

If you've never been to The W Hotel Hoboken, you'll be tempted to say "THIS is Hoboken?" The hotel is particularly beautiful and elegant.

The W Hotel is located on River and 3rd Streets, directly across from the Hudson River, and has stunning river views. It's a beautiful place to relax and have drinks with friends, and is an easy walk from Mamoun's.

On our way from Mamoun's to the W Hotel, we will take a beautiful and leisurely stroll on the Hudson River. That stroll will include a visit to a park and pier that juts out onto the Hudson River. It is a magnificent place to relax on a summer evening, and enjoy the river breezes and stunning Manhattan views.


Train Directions from Manhattan: Take the PATH train to Hoboken. From the Hoboken PATH train station, walk to the corner of Washington St. & 5th Street. Mamoun's is almost on the corner. (If you haven't been to Hoboken before, you should look on Google Maps first to see where this all is. The walk is a little under a mile, I would say. It's a nice walk down Washington Street, and it will be quite an experience if you haven't done it before.)

Join us as we go from the incredibly cheap -- and so delicious! -- to the beautifully upscale. And see what can only be seen from Hoboken at night!

David
results.name: Hoboken: Mamoun's Falafel, The W Hotel, Summertime Stroll on the Hudson River!

results.description:
This talk will cover various aspects of Logic Programming. We examine Logic Programming in the contexts of Programming Languages, Mathematical Logic and Machine Learning.

We will we start with an introduction to Prolog and metaprogramming in Prolog. We will also discuss how miniKanren and Core.Logic differ from Prolog while maintaining the paradigms of logic programming.

We will then cover the Unification Algorithm in depth and examine the mathematical motivations which are rooted in Skolem Normal Form. We will describe the process of converting a statement in first order logic to clausal form logic. We will also discuss the applications of the Unification Algorithm to automated theorem proving and type inferencing.

Finally we will look at the role of Prolog in the context of Machine Learning. This is known as Inductive Logic Programming. In that context we will briefly review Decision Tree Learning and it's relationship to ILP. We will then examine Sequential Covering Algorithms for learning clauses in Propositional Calculus and then the more general  FOIL algorithm for learning sets of Horn clauses in First Order Predicate Calculus. Examples will be given in both Common Lisp and Clojure for these algorithms.

Pierre de Lacaze has over 20 years’ experience with Lisp and AI based technologies. He holds a Bachelor of Science in Applied Mathematics and Computer Science and a Master’s Degree in Computer Science. He is one of the Director's of LispNYC.org and is currently a Senior Developer at Shareablee.

Pizza and beer will be generously provided by Shareablee.

Links will be provided shortly.
results.name: Logic Programming by Pierre de Lacaze

results.description:
EDITH PIAF AT 100: A celebration of her Centennial

New cabaret show tells Piaf’s story through song, circus and burlesque

Our member Myriam Phiro guides us through the decadent world of Edith Piaf using her timeless songs to retell the life of this iconic performer. Accompanied by a traditional musette band and multi-disciplinary backup singers, Ms. Phiro and the ensemble recreate the brothels, circuses and nightclubs that created the great Piaf we all know. The performance lasts 60-70 minutes. 

2015 marks Edith Piaf's centennial. ‘La Môme Piaf’, as she was nicknamed, introduced America to the world of ‘Chanson Réaliste’. Her songbook has become classic and still engages audiences worldwide. However, her early life is shrouded in mystery – daughter of a circus performer, childhood in a brothel, blind for years and ‘miraculously’ cured by a pilgrimage St. Therese – these stories and more are brought to life with music, dance and circus performance in our exciting cabaret show.

Myriam Phiro is an internationally acclaimed actress, singer and cabaret chanteuse. Piaf is Ms. Phiro’s greatest inspiration and the reason she chose to become a perfomer. Ms. Phiro now regularly fronts several jazz, swing and musette bands in New York and Montreal. She has residencies at the House of Jazz in Montreal and Harry's New York Bar in Montreux. New York City appearances include the Rainbow Room, Sleep No More, the Bronx Botanical Garden, the Back Room Speakeasy, Whynot Jazzroom, Pravda NYC, Don't Tell Mama, Gemini & Scorpio Events, Jalopy Theatre & Music School, and the Triad Theatre. Myriam released her debut EP My Rêverie in 2013 and her full-length jazz album will be released in 2015.

Myriam Phiro website: myriamphiro.com

Myriam Phiro's traditional musette band will be led by accordionist/director Benjamin Ickies. Mr. Ickies is often seen performing and directing cabaret shows with a variety of artists including John Kelly, Kim David Smith, Michael T and many more.

SHOW INFO:
June 9th, 8pm @Drom (door 7pm)
85 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009
Phone: <a>(646)[masked]</a>
Tickets: $20 (Adv. $15; through website)
http://www.dromnyc.com/events/3940/edith-piaf-a...­

***Note: This event is for experienced players only (NTRP rating 3.0 and above)***



Join us for Summer Tennis at Lincoln Park under lights from 7 till 10 pm. 

Upon arrival, check in at the Clubhouse before proceeding to the courts.

Please follow these GUIDELINES for an enjoyable tennis session:


1. Members shall meet outside the Clubhouse at the scheduled time.

2. First two to arrive shall reserve a court with the Clubhouse staff.

3. Post the details (court #, names of players) on meetup comments, and then start playing.


4. As more members arrive, they may join in on the posted court# if space is available (max. 4 players per court), while continuing to update the player count on the comments.

5. If the posted court is full, wait till at least one other player arrives, and then reserve a new court. Then repeat from step 3. :-)

Important Information Regarding Court Reservations:


• Reservation is free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as guests of the residents to avoid a possible $10 fee.


• Minimum two players must be present to reserve a court.

RSVP Etiquette:

• Please keep your RSVP updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

• No shows may be bumped from future events.

Inclement weather cancels the event.


If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.


Thank you all for this great group!

results.description:
Join Be Social Change on Tuesday, June 9th, from 7 PM to 8:30PM for Accounting 101 - Getting Your Finances In Order with Jennifer Alleva, Partner at Your Part-Time Controller, LLC. 


===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: 

http://bit.ly/AccountingJun9

===========================================

If you don’t know your numbers, you don’t know your business! Proper accounting and financial management systems are crucial to your success.


In this course we will explore best practices in bookkeeping, accounting, financial management and how to set up your systems so that they are scalable as you grow. Using group learning, real-life case studies and financial statements, this course will provide you with the practical knowledge you need to run your nonprofit or for-profit social enterprise.


WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

• Basic financial statement concepts

• Reading and interpreting your financial statements

• The difference between an accountant and a bookkeeper

• Setting-up your accounting systems for success and growth:

• Selecting an accounting software package

• Apps for tracking and recording expenses

• Payroll services

• Budgets

• Financial statements  

• Chart-of-accounts

• Responsibilities and tasks of your accounting “department”

• Other best practices in financial management that you need to know about:

• Internal controls to reduce the risk of fraud

• Benchmarking and analysis

• Forecasting

• Cash management and reserves


WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Leaders who want to develop or improve their financial management systems

• Management or board members of existing nonprofits

• Individuals contemplating founding a social enterprise or nonprofit

• Changemakers who want to learn necessary steps before launching a project or social venture

INSTRUCTOR BIO

Jennifer Alleva is a CPA with over 25 years of accounting and financial management experience. Jen is a Partner with Your Part-Time Controller, LLC. For 20 years, YPTC has helped nonprofit and for-profit organizations be successful by providing expert financial management services. In her spare time, Jen loves to teach and is on the faculty of the University of Pennsylvania Fels School.

You can learn about her work here and her background here. 

SPACE PARTNER 

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/KPL4uynCqIoMu2deyfpUIP59J1-rk9uZwr8AQMeHBdGbJTw9YsL_JSkKxTZucHnuclxQsW120aO4HFk4uK8rilV2ZxPHbeyg-sLyxfzjQdMmcjLV-29EequKqpboQGQlLg


The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/ 

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.
results.name: BSC Class: Accounting 101 - Getting Your Finances In Order

results.description:
Living with Lyme can be a very trying and life-altering experience.  Having a Community of Lyme Warriors there for You, who know and understand what you are going through, are there to talk with, share ideas and discuss the mountains of information on the internet is very important to one's recovery.  

Please join us to share your experiences and strategies for Living with Lyme.  All stages and types of lyme/co-infection patients are welcome.  Caretakers, family and friends of Lyme patients are also welcome.  There is no charge to attend, donations are gladly accepted though to help pay for the space.

The evening will include open discussion, a short guided meditation and opportunity for attendees to browse through Bryan Rosner's new book "Freedom from Lyme Disease". 

http://www.amazon.com/Freedom-Lyme-Disease-Treatments-Complete/dp/0988243741/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1422560584&sr=8-1&keywords=freedom+from+lyme+disease

May you feel well today!

Alison

p.s. This is a self-managed group, facilitated by an acupuncturist, meditation practitioner, sound healer who is diagnosed with neurological lyme.
results.name: Building Community

We will be meeting at Info Commons in room #2.  PLEASE NOTE that we limit attendance to better insure that all get a chance to have their writing critiqued.  If our maximum for the week is reached, you have the option of being notified when someone changes their RSVP to no.  PLEASE DO NOT RSVP YES UNLESS YOU ARE AS SURE AS IS HUMANLY POSSIBLE THAT YOU WILL BE ABLE TO ATTEND AND CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO NO IMMEDIATELY if your situation does change, for the sake of those waiting for a spot.  


Join us for a weekly get together of sometimes frank and hopefully always constructive criticism of your literary work. There is no restriction on the type of genre and only a few rules:

1. Bring up to 6 double spaced typed pages of your work for reading. Additional copies would be helpful in order to allow others in the group to follow along.

2. The author is not allowed to speak while feedback is being provided.

3. The same piece should not be reread at a future workshop.

We will meet every Tuesday at 7 PM on the first floor of the Central Library, unless a meetup is not scheduled for that date due to a holiday or other event. A floor plan link is available at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/sites/default/files/files/pdf/central/floorplan.pdf.

More information about the Brooklyn Central Library, including available public transportation options, can be found at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/locations/central.

Hope to see all of you there.

 

Danny

Kundalini Yoga, Meditaiton and Gong Bath class is also highly recommended for beginners. Pranayam [breathing exercises] and kriyas [kundalini yoga set] or asanas are used to prepare the body and mind for a deeper effect of the gong bath.

Gong Yoga has profound healing abilities. Immediate effects are common, since blood circulation is increased to bring in fresh nutrients, and will continue healing for days after the class.

Students participating in multiple gong classes accumulate the most healing benefits. Recommended for releasing stress, clearing negative thought patterns and strengthening the nervous system.

Eat lightly two hours prior to the session.

Kundalini Yoga, as taught by Yogi Bhajan, is based upon the sound current, the power of word and mantra, and the vibration of the infinite. This primal sound is best represented by the sound of the Gong itself.

“There is only one thing that can supersede and command the human mind – the sound of the Gong. It is the first sound of the Universe. It is the basic creative sound”. Yogi Bhajan

“If you meditate on the primal sound, you will see the unseen, you will hear the unheard, and you feel the unfeelable.” ~Yogi Bhajan~

The Zumba® program fuses hypnotic Latin rhythms and easy-to-follow moves to create a one-of-a-kind fitness program that will blow you away. Our goal is simple: We want you to want to work out, to love working out, to get hooked. Zumba® Fanatics achieve long-term benefits while experiencing an absolute blast in one exciting hour of calorie-burning, body-energizing, awe-inspiring movements meant to engage and captivate for life!


7:15PM- 8:15 PM
We will accommodate all levels so if you are New or have been shaking it for awhile come down and join us. There is plenty of room to grow here.

Our goal is simple: We want you to want to work out, to love working out, to get hooked. results.description:
IMPROV FOR ACTORS - There's No "I" in Ensemble

This Improve with Improv workshop will focus on working as an ensemble. Whether you're playing a principal role, a supportive role, or even if you're off stage, you are still part of a team and have a role to play.

You will engage in group exercises, games and scenes that train the performer to give and take the spotlight, to stay engaged and involved in what is going on on stage, and to work as a team.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.

Suggested Donation: $15 (most improv classes in NYC cost $35-$50 per session or more)


THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV

Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.

Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.
results.name: Improv for Actors - There's No "I" in Ensemble

results.description:
Now you can take a live Insanity class at Zion Lutheran Church by Certified Insanity Fitness Instructors, Marie-Elena Aruta and Michelle McKenzie. All guests will receive a 1 week complimentary guest pass to LA Fitness Staten Island.
This revolutionary cardio-based total-body conditioning program is based on the principles of MAX interval training. INSANITY pushes the participants to new training heights, resulting in more calories burned, faster results and more efficient metabolism. This interval training is the pinnacle of cardio training. You don't have to be in extreme shape - levels of each exercise are provided.
Insanity's not your traditional interval workout. It replaces traditional moderate-intensity exercise with maximum-intensity exercise, and trades short intervals of intensity for short periods of rest. The secret? Long periods of explosive intensity. You’ll do cardio and plyometric drills with intervals of strength, power, resistance, and core training. With Insanity, you can burn up to 1,000 calories in an hour. Participants experience faster increases in cardiovascular fitness and burn carbohydrates and fat more efficiently.

Class Description:
PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!
☆☆☆$10.00 for a limited time only☆☆☆

results.description:
Come join your peers from Westchester County and the surrounding areas (hello Bronx, Connecticut, Orange and Putnam Counties) for our long-running lively, friendly facilitated discussion group. 

Our group is for ALL people (cisgender, transgender/gender non-conforming, and not-quite-sure people) as well as people who fall on different places along the monogamous to polyamorous dimension. As long as you inhabit the space between totally straight and totally gay somewhere (i.e., bisexual/non-monosexual queer, same-gender-loving, bicurious, questioning and bi-friendly). 

People who wish to understand their bisexual loved ones are also welcome.

This group is for people over 18. It is NOT a hook-up group. As the name says, we meet to talk about bisexual issues. People whose behavior makes other group members uncomfortable will be asked to leave. 

The group meets at The LOFT LGBT Community Center​ in White Plains, Westchester County, New York at 7:30 PM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of every month. 

Even if you can't always make it to the group meetings in person, please join us on line, ask questions, chat, make some "net-friends" and keep up with what is happening in the Westchester County and surrounding bisexual community.
results.name: 2nd Tuesday Westchester Bisexual Discussion & Support Group

group.name: NYC's Bisexual, Non-Monosexual & Queer Meetup Group

results.description:
The Morris County Ski Club meets on the 2nd and 4th Tuesday of the month (the 2nd Tuesday only in June, July, August and December). Although our name says ski club, we are a year round activities and social club.

Our membership meetings and happy hours (AAF) are free to attend, and are always fun filled. Joining our club is very inexpensive; $50 for the first year and $35 per year afterwards.

The benefits of joining our club include access to members only events and trips, and discounts at most of the ski resorts in NY, PA, & VT, and local ski shops.

We foster an environment to meet new people, partake in various activities.  You can even suggest and/or run new events. If you come to one of our meetings you'll see how everyone is having a good time while learning about our events.

results.description:
Here is a unique opportunity to join a healing group that meets regularly to support your needs using the amazing potential of Tapping.

There will NOT be a lot of discussion or socializing because we will be too busy Tapping on specific and general issues of our Emtional and Physical concerns using EFT and something called Tong Ren.

EFT is well known for eliminating the causes of emotional distress. Many people are also aware of using EFT for physical well being. Sometimes we need to look at the emotional aspects that may be behind the issues of concern, and sometimes we just tap directly on the symptoms and notice if we get relief just from that. Its very nice when this happens and it happens a lot.

Tong Ren is another form of healing using tapping but unlike EFT it doesnt involve any dialog to describe the issues of concern. We just tap on a surragate model (Tong Ren) as if we were doing acupunture on a real body with intention of healing and it works!!!!

We'll meet at Jain's home in Scarsdale every 2nd and 4th Tuesday evening and whoever is interested in joining us is welcome. The only stipulation is that whatever issue you bring to our attention you let us tap on it.
results.name: Tapping Meetup for Emotional and Physical Healing with EFT and Tong Ren

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Come to our new cabaret show telling Piaf’s story through song, circus and burlesque!

On JUNE 9TH at 8pm, I will happily guide you through the decadent world of Edith Piaf using her timeless songs to retell the life of this iconic performer who’ve inspired me so much in becoming an artist. Accompanied by a traditional musette band and multi-disciplinary backup singers, I will recreate the brothels, circuses and nightclubs that created the great Piaf we all know. The performance will last 60-70 minutes.

2015 marks Edith Piaf’s centennial. ‘La Môme Piaf’, as she was nicknamed, introduced America to the world of ‘Chanson Réaliste’. Her songbook has become classic and still engages audiences worldwide. However, her early life is shrouded in mystery – daughter of a circus performer, childhood in a brothel, blind for years and ‘miraculously’ cured by a pilgrimage St. Therese – these stories and more are brought to life with music, dance and circus performance in our exciting cabaret show.

Come to the Cabaret and let us serenade you! Make your reservation now:
JUNE 9TH PERFORMANCE AT DROM (http://www.dromnyc.com/calendar/0/06/2015)


Visit our OFFICIAL FACEBOOK PAGE (https://www.facebook.com/events/1588200554785606/) for all update. Let's hang out after the show! I'll be looking forward to seeing you soon! :)
results.name: Edith Piaf at 100: A celebration of her Centennial (AT DROM)

results.description:
Note that the cost is $10 (charged by the Brooklyn Brainery) and you need to get your ticket here (scroll down on the  page to locate and click on the event): 

http://brooklynbrainery.com/courses/

DESCRIPTION (by the Brooklyn Brainery): 


By some estimates, for every New Yorker you see walking around on the streets, there’s one New Yorker underground, riding the train. That’s right - 1/2 of New York’s population is on some form of public transportation at any given moment.

This miraculous statistic means that the city we know truly couldn’t exist without its subways, buses, and taxis, but how did all this heavy, stinky, old fashioned infrastructure get built?

This class covers NYC transportation from the early days, when the best you could hope for was a mud-spattered omnibus ride, through the first steam-powered elevated railroads, all the way up to the Pan Am building helicopter shuttle. It also touches on the many ambitious, zany, quixotic efforts to get us from Point A to Point B. Have you ever been sucked through a tunnel?

Patrick Lamson-Hall is an urban planner at the NYU Stern Urbanization Project. His interests include urbanization in the developing world, alternative transportation, and public space. Before becoming an urban planner he worked as a journalist, a dishwasher, and an anarchist. He’s currently researching historical densities in Manhattan as well as implementing an urban expansion initiative in four cities in Ethiopia.

DIRECTIONS: B/Q to 7th Ave or 2/3 to Grand Army Plaza
results.name: A History of New York City Transportation - From Horsecars to Helicopters

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email. 


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>) 


----------------------------------------------------------------

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.


These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.


You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on their own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Hey Everyone!


The group is once again invited to a great night of comedy on Tues June 9th at 9:30pm at Gotham Comedy Club!


EVERYONE IN THE GROUP CAN GET FREE TICKETS!!! This is one of the BEST comedy clubs in NYC!!


Tickets are normally priced at $15 each! If anyone wants to go, just make sure to RSVP through the online link below to get your tickets.


https://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-admission-gotham-comedy-club-tues-june-9th-930pm-tickets-17141721350


The show is called "Comedy Juice" and features all professional comedians (no amateurs), who you've seen on: Comedy Central, Saturday Night Live, Chelsea Lately, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Conan, etc), HBO, Showtime, & More! This show definitely features some of the BEST comedians in comedy!


In the past 2 months, this show has had HUGE special guests including: Kevin Hart, Louis CK, Jerry Seinfeld, Dave Attell, Jim Gaffigan, Colin Jost, & Judah Friedlander!!


The show starts at 9:30pm but they request you all arrive inside the club by 9:15pm. There's a great bar next door called Jake's Saloon that everyone can meet up at before the show, this is the easiest way to find & meet the group! Meet there by 9pm and go in all together!!


The show is 18+ & Gotham Comedy Club has a 2 drink minimum per person (drinks don't have to be alcohol)


Hope to see you all at the show!

Family and matrimonial law matters can cause undue stress and anxiety when emotional disputes intersect with legal matters.  Come to our meeting on June 10th and find out how Steven Segalas, Partner at Damiano Law Offices, resolves family issues as swiftly and compassionately as possible.  He caters to the individual needs of each client by explaining his or her rights and options thoroughly with his complete comprehensive Knowledge of NJ family and matrimonial laws. 

Mr. Segalas has been resolving complex matrimonial actions with Damiano Law Offices for the last 18 years.  He emphasizes on comprehensive, compassionate and cutting-edge service, he offers expertise in professional trial advocacy, negotiation, collaborative law, mediation, prenuptial and postnuptial agreements, child custody and support, spousal maintenance, property division, and modifications and enforcement.


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!

Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. We are currently looking to fill the following categories:

Painter

Home Renovations

If you or know someone in the above catagories and are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on June 10th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

results.description:
We cordially invite you to attend our upcoming TDWI NYC Tri-State Chapter meeting on June 10, 2015.  As a follow-on to our Q1 meeting topic – Hadoop Technology, Vendors and Marketplace – the June 10th meeting will focus on business value, and real-life use cases applying this technology. Hadoop continues to generate broad interest in the business intelligence, analytics and data management industry as a workhorse to address a new class of business opportunities and insight. Please join us for presentations by: Mr. Mark Grabb -  Technology Leader for Analytics at the General Electric (GE) Global Research Center in New York and others.

Come meet other local professionals, swap business cards, share ideas, and exchange career advice while listening to quality presentations in a vendor-neutral setting, which is the hallmark of TDWI education. Our speakers will be DW/BI end-users reporting on their success and lessons learned implementing various BI tools or projects. Please see our detailed meeting agenda below.

Topic:

“Hadoop Part 2: Business Applications and Value”. Presentations by Mr. Mark Grabb - Technology Leader for Analytics at the General Electric Global Research Center in New York and colleagues -  Enterprise Data Architecture Leader in financial services. Mark and other speakers will compare and contrast their different experiences for very rich presentations that are sure to be very interesting and very practical.  Presenters will open the discussion for questions.  Key topics and questions addressed in these presentations will include:

Business Opportunities & New ApplicationsWhat are the new business opportunities addressable by Hadoop?Which users can be served, and what is the user experience?What types of technology problems can be solved?Senior Management Selling PointsWhat are the main selling points your executives are hearing?What are likely to be the practical advantages derived?Obstacles to AdoptionWhat are the major management concerns? From experience, what are the ‘lessons learned’?

The seminar is open to all business, analytics, and IT professionals.  There is no fee to attend our program , although registration is required -- before 9-June.  Presentation: "Business Applications and Value” by Mr. Mark Grabb
Mark Grabb has experience with analytics using Hadoop across a breadth of different industries and use cases. He will discuss his approach and experience, and discuss the efficiencies over legacy approaches as well as examples of other upside benefits. Mark will speak to how Hadoop has allowed GE to transition from a big iron company to services around big data. Some fascinating examples of the “internet of things” and the relationship to big data will be discussed.

Mark Grabb is the Technology Leader for Analytics at the General Electric Global Research Center in New York. The Analytics Technology Organization includes labs with expertise in Applied Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Quantitative Finance, Operations Research, Machine Learning, Signal Processing, Image Analysis, and Computer Vision. Analytics Research at GE and for GE is primarily focused on the company’s services businesses in the industrial sectors as well as GE Capital in financial services. Mark and his teams invent and develop big data analytics that are key components within larger GE Software solutions that enable GE’s customers to generate profit by increasing their revenues, lowering their costs, and managing their risks.  Mark holds over 26 issued US patents. He is a registered patent agent with the United States Patent office
results.name: Hadoop: Business Applications and Value

The event will provide an opportunity and forum for local NY and Tri-State NetSuite users to facilitate learning by sharing ideas, experiences, and software best practices to maximize your NetSuite investment. It’s also a great networking opportunity to allow you to meet and reach out to other local NetSuite users.

Coffee and pastries will be offered throughout the event as well as several breakout and networking sessions.

results.description:
Hadoop continues to generate broad interest in the business intelligence, analytics and data management industry as a workhorse to address a new class of business opportunities and insight. As a follow-on to our Q1 program – Hadoop Technology, Vendors and Marketplace – the June 10th seminar will focus on business value, and real-life use cases applying this technology. Attendees can expect to hear from practitioners who have experience making the business case for Hadoop, and have begun their journey of implementation and adoption within their organizations.

Join us for presentations by:

Mr. Mark Grabb -- Technology Leader for Analytics at the General Electric Global Research Center in New York.

Mr. Priya Ranjan -- Enterprise Data Architecture Leader in financial services.

Key topics and questions addressed at this event will include:

• Business Opportunities & New Applications

• What are the new business opportunities addressable by Hadoop?

• Which users can be served, and what is the user experience?

• What types of technology problems can be solved?

• Senior Management Selling Points

• What are the main selling points your executives are hearing?

• What are likely to be the practical advantages derived?

• Obstacles to Adoption

• What are the major management concerns? 

• From experience, what are the ‘lessons learned’?

Mark Grabb has experience with analytics using Hadoop across a breadth of different industries and use cases. He will discuss his approach and experience, and discuss the efficiencies over legacy approaches as well as examples of other upside benefits. Mark will speak to how Hadoop has allowed GE to transition from a big iron company to services around big data. Some fascinating examples of the “internet of things” and the relationship to big data will be discussed.

Priya  Ranjan will discuss big data usage of trade data at a major financial and how Hadoop was used to augment existing systems to achieve the velocity and efficiencies driven by the modern explosion of data. He will address how this can be done in a legacy environment with significant compliance constraints. Priya will also discuss some of the major pitfalls that should be avoided.

Mark and Priya will compare and contrast their different experiences for very rich presentations that will are sure to be very interesting and very practical.  Presenters will open the discussion for questions.
results.name: Hadoop Part 2:   Business Applications and Value

group.name: TDWI New York Tri-State Area Chapter

results.description:
Moderate pace, lots of loose rock and elevation involved so it will not be just a straight shot like walking in Central Park on flat ground in the grass. This hike is 2 miles in & 2 miles out totalling 4 miles round trip so about 30 minutes back to the car from the lake. We will make our way to a Hidden Lake at an undisclosed location where be lollygagging & swimming all day and have lunch there for about 3 hours. We will be parking at Sebago boat launch it is 5 miles from the Sloatsburg New York train station

Since this is the hangout spot we may or not be going out to eat afterwards depending on the group; bring your submarine sandwich and whatever you are drinking with you, bug spray and plenty of sunblock! for those of you who are totally stoked to party because it is Friday and would like to go out afterwards there is a possibility for Rhodes tavern North afterwards this is a disclosed location just at the entrance to the park 1 block from the train station with outdoor seating by the stream at the sand bar gezebo.

Parking:

Travel 2.5 miles north of Reeves and Sebago boat launch will be on left. Reeves is 2.5 miles from the train station. That makes the train station is 5 miles from the trailhead lot. Please do not sign up if you are taking the train and do not have a way to get to the trailhead lot; you can still post I need a ride!!! from the train station and see if anyone volunteers to pick you up and drive you back after. If someone agrees to do so you can then sign up at that point.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: Swim/Harriman intermediate  hike!

results.description:
Nikon is one of the most recognized brands in the photography industry and their commitment to innovative cameras places them as an industry leader. Come by the store to learn more about Nikon's latest camera offerings and how they are right for you.


Come meet Nikon tech rep Alex Podstawski and get all of your Nikon technical questions answered.  In-store from 10 AM – 3 PM.

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography: Alex Podstawski has been working as a Nikon Technical Representative since early 2012.  At age 13 he began shooting on his first camera, a Nikon FE and has been working with light and cameras ever since.  Working in the photo industry since age 16 and shooting weddings only two years later, Alex has gained experience uncommon for someone his age.  His specialties include infrared and ultraviolet photography, portrait, landscape, wedding, event, wireless flash, and auto racing, among others.  With years of experience working in photo labs and specialty stores, as well as a diverse professional career, Alex is eager share his knowledge and enthusiasm for photography at every opportunity. 


http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/AlexPodstawski_HEAD.jpg?itok=36Erxnka
results.name: VENDOR DAY: Nikon

results.description:
Hi everyone,

I'm excited to announce a great opportunity for the right crew. The Manhattan Holistic Chamber of Commerce has agreed to allow our group to film their open house event June 10th from 11a-1p and ultimately make a short video out of it.

This event is all about health and wellness, and promoting a holistic approach to our daily lives. In addition, and of interest to our members, having the opportunity to network with a Chamber of Commerce provides incredible opportunities when we deliver our polished and professional finished product.

Therefore, I'm looking for shooters, editors, sound, motion graphics, and possibly lighting people for this gig. We can have a pre-planning meeting to discuss equipment and timing (the meeting has a rigid agenda down to the minute) and of course, since you will be representing our group and myself, I expect professionalism from all involved, including our attire. Not necessarily suits and ties, but a professional look, business casual works.

Please let me know ASAP if you would like to be a part of this great opportunity, list your equipment, and how you can contribute to the shoot. We will arrive at 10:15 and have 45 minutes to set up our equipment for a prompt 11am start.

Please let me know if you have any questions, and welcome aboard!

Jordan
results.name: Manhattan Holistic Chamber of Commerce Open House Video

If you're interested in meeting up at this event, please RSVP so that we can all try to find a good place to meet.

Here's the info to get a free pass for all 3 days of the conference:
1. Go to the special registration page - 
https://www.blueskyz.com/v3/Login.aspx?ClientID=19&EventID=110&sg=402 
2. Fill out the Attendee Information form 
3. Select the VIP Gold Pass Registration Option (located on page 3 - “Registration Plan”) 
4. Enter the Discount Code: FacultyGuest 
5. The price will re-set to $0 

Faculty Guest registration does not include lunch or the Collectible Conference Bag, but does provide Full Conference Access for all 3 days – June 9-11. Your guests can choose from our 125+ breakout sessions, general sessions, industry keynotes, and Power Panels and of course attend the Expo Floor.

results.description:
Hello,

This long running pick-up plays in Chinatown and has a long & storied history. The game has been going 12 years+, and was born by a group of Irish, English, Scottish and German expats who needed a mid-week footballing outlet. The group has now expanded to include players from around a dozen countries.

The group is looking for additional players to complement the game. The match is played in a sporting yet competitive spirit. This is for seasoned players - NO beginners please.

A good attitude, positional sense and a preference for passing is a must. We usually play for 1.5 hours year round.. as long as the weather allows.

RSVP is required to attend the game. There are a number of regulars who attend each week in addition to the meetup list.

Someone usually brings pinnies, but bring a white and black top just in case.

See you there.
results.name: Chinatown Pick-up Wednesdays @ noon

Join us on Wednesday, June 10th for the re\VISION speaker series. An afternoon of speakers, panels, and of course -- networking! 

From Red Bull to Marriott, in today’s “Content is King” online world everyone is trying to become a publisher. re\VISION New York - We Are All Publishers: Keys to Content Marketing we will explore how to effectively use, write and promote content for your business.

Here's jus some of what you will learn from TOP INDUSTRY PROFESSIONALS (bios included below):

• How to Measure Content Marketing ROI

• How to use Content for Inbound Leads

• How to become Creative With Your Content Creation

• How to Reuse Effective Content

_____________________________________________________


About re\VISION: 


re\VISION is a speaker series and professional forum to encourage discussion on today’s fast-moving digital ecosystem. It seeks to uncover and explore the challenges that content creators, digital publishers, marketers, web designers and business professionals all endure in the digital landscape. We invite you to join us for insightful presentations and to take part in discussions about current and future digital trends.


To keep up with future re\VISION New York events, join our new Meetup group re\VISION New York Digital Experts.

_____________________________________________________

Guest Speakers:

Jay Acunzo: Vice President of Platform and Content at NextView Ventures, Founder of Boston Content

Jay is the VP of platform and content at NextView Ventures, a top VC firm investing in seed-stage tech startups. For the firm, he led all content and branding, and supports nearly 50 strart-up companies with exclusive resources and initiatives. Jay is also a co-founder of Boston Content, a local community group helping over 1,000 content marketers. He's led content at HubSpot (IPO) and Dailybreak Media (acquired) and began as a digital media strategist at Google. Read more about Jay on his blog SorryForMarketing.com. 

Tom Critchlow: Founder of Fiercely Curious & Fiercely Made (Co-founder of Distilled New York)

Tom has spent the past decade working with startups, media companies and Fortune 500s to develop SEO, content and product strategies. He founded the Distilled NYC office, worked at Google for two years and is now running Fiercely Curious an online art boutique while also consulting on the intersection of product and marketing. Read more about Tom on his blog tomcritchlow.com.

Sujan Patel: Vice President of Marketing at When I Work

Sujan has 12 years of experience in digital marketing and is the VP of Marketing at When I Work. He is also an avid blogger and writes for Forbes, Inc., Wall Street Journal and Entrepreneur. In his spare time he created Content Marketer, a tool to help automate and scale content marketing and co-authored the Growth Hacking eBook 100 Days of Growth. Read more about Sujan on his blog sujanpatel.com.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

Description:

The re\VISION speaker series returns to New York, this time covering a new topic: content marketing.

Today, everyone is trying to become a publisher. But not many know how to create effective content or how to best get their content in front of their target audience.

At re\VISION New York We Are All Publishers: Keys to Content Marketing, we will explore what it takes to get the most out of content marketing through guest speakers and panel sessions by sharing with you the best practices from brand and content marketing experts.

_____________________________________________________

Guest Speakers:

Jay Acunzo: Vice President of Platform and Content at NextView Ventures

Jay is the VP of platform and content at NextView Ventures, a top VC firm investing in seed-stage tech startups. For the firm, he led all content and branding, and supports nearly 50 strart-up companies with exclusive resources and initiatives. Jay is also a co-founder of Boston Content, a local community group helping over 1,000 content marketers. He's led content at HubSpot (IPO) and Dailybreak Media (acquired) and began as a digital media strategist at Google. Learn more about Jay on his blog SorryForMarketing.com.

results.description:
Le Français, ça ouvre des portes et ça donne des ailes !

Let's have a conversation in French! Join us as we work on our French speaking skills. Members can bring some materials for all to start with and then work from there.

I look forward to seeing you make some milestones as each week passes by.

Don will look for a table in the quietest area and will either get a small french flag to display or lay out a couple of French books on the table

We usually have the following weekly schedule:

- French Mondays with the Frenchies for a big multi-French-meetup party (an average of 7 meetup groups together). You are encouraged to join my other small group here:

http://www.meetup.com/frenchies

- Wednesdays Afternoons at the Atrium

- Fridays with French-Morrocan parties and/or International Clubbing at Cellar Bar


If you don't receive automatic notifications about our events each week, check your meetup.com email settings.

Merci et Bises à toutes et à tous !

Jean-Philippe
results.how_to_find_us: Don will look for a table in the quietest area and will either get a small french flag to display or lay out a couple of French books on the table
results.name: Mercredi Français - French Conversation WORKSHOP with Ruth

results.description:
Join us as we welcome Ellen McDermott as she will be discussing Interior Photography of how lighting and composition can be used to bring out dynamic aspects of architecture and design. Her goal as an interior photographer is to accentuate the distinct point of view of the designer or architect, the client.


All in attendance will be given a coupon for $25 off your next purchase of $250.

This seminar will be two (2) sessions of ninety (90) minutes each

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/EllenMcDermott_HEAD.jpg?itok=1E7rzM6N

Ellen McDermott is a New York City based photographer. Born and raised in New England, she studied fine arts in Boston with a focus in photography. Upon graduating, Ellen moved to San Francisco to become proficient in digital photography and took an assignment with Butterfield and Butterfield, one of the first companies to go digital in the United States. Once arriving in New York, she began shooting for Christie's, Cooper-Hewitt Museum, Northeast Auctions, Tourneau, JCrew, amongst many others. Her work has appeared in countless advertising campaigns, books, and magazines such as "House Beautiful", "Martha Stewart Living", "Country Living", "Town and Country" and Chronicle books to name a few. Ellen is always excited to work with new clients in achieving photographic excellence for their projects in addition to exploring new creative possibilities with her existing clients.

Check out her website ellenmcdermott.com/
results.name: SEMINAR: Interior Photography with Ellen McDermott

results.description:
• Help us to Fund this at IndieGoGo !

June 10th marks the 100th Anniversary of the first documented public showing of a 3D Film. It took place in New York City’s Times Square at the Astor Theatre which was located at 45th and Broadway. The Astor was demolished  in the 1980’s and The Marriott Marquis Hotel now stands in its place. The </a><a href="https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/100th-anniversary-of-the-first-3d-movie-screening/x/www.3dnsa.org">New York Stereoscopic Association is planning an event at the Marriott Marquis to commemorate this important centennial.  We’re hosting  the founder of the 3D Film Archives, Robert Furmanek. He’ll be screening rare 3D footage some of which will be shown at the Museum of Modern Art during their 3D Summer event. Some footage will only be seen here! We have many surprises planned. Ask anyone who has been to our events and they'll tell you it's a thrill a minute! Wonder why we're the only ones celebrating this momentous event in cinema? Because we care about history and NYC. Help support us at IndieGoGo! Or contribute right from this site.
results.how_to_find_us: Astor Ballroom 7th Floor
results.name: 100th Anniversary of First 3D Film.  Presented by the NYSA

Smart Materials + Wearable Design:  we're experimenting with Wearable Wednesday! Calling all fashion designers, soft circuit enthusiasts and curious makers! Come explore the world of wearable design. Bring your own project if there's something you are working on, or start something here! Want to brush up on your sewing skills and interested in learning about e-textiles? Pick up an Invent-abling Smart Sewing kit when you come by for only $12.

**I cannot guarantee laser access/monitoring on Wednesdays, so please ask in advance if you'd like to use it and we can try to work it out.

results.description:
Come join us for our monthly toastmaster meetings (2nd and 4th Wednesday). Please RSVP to ensure you're on the roster with the building security.

Context: We meet to practice our public speaking and to support others in their skill development by providing feedback. The meeting is usually structured into sections devoted to prepared speeches, unprepared speeches, and the evaluation of those speeches.
results.how_to_find_us: (1) Go to the security booth, (2) tell them you're with toastmaster at Adobe on the 17th floor, (3) give them your ID, (4) take the temporary badge, (5) come up the elevators to 17 and through the Adobe doors.

This class is set up for skaters of all levels.

As always, we will meet at the Blades store, so all students can rent/purchase protection equipment, required to participate in class. 
We will leave the store promptly at 6:00PM to get to the class location. 
Cost of this class is: $25 per individual class, $45 for 2 classes or $60 for package of 3 classes; fees are collected before class begins, however we suggest that you to pay in advance, using Pay Pal option.

Please note that you must have complete set of protection gear and helmet to participate in class.

E-Myth \ 'e-,'mith\ n 1: the entrepreneurial myth: the myth that most people who start small businesses are entrepreneurs 2: the fatal assumption that an individual who understands the technical work of a business can successfully run a business that does that technical work


Today we’ll have an introduction to Michael Gerber’s phenomenal bestseller which dispels the myths about starting your own business. Gerber, with sharp insight gained from years of experience, points out how common assumptions, expectations, and even technical expertise can get in the way of running a successful business.


Gerber walks you through the steps in the life of a business—from entrepreneurial infancy through adolescent growing pains to the mature entrepreneurial perspective -- and shows how to apply the lessons of franchising to any business, whether or not it is a franchise.


Most importantly, Gerber draws the vital, often overlooked distinction between working on your business and working in your business.


In 30 days, after everyone reads the book, we’ll have a discussion of the book and lessons learned.
