results.description:
Join us on Wednesday, June 10th from 7PM to 8:30PM for Meditation 101: Learn How to Increase Presence, Focus, and Creativity, with meditation trainer and nonprofit professional Jenn Lishansky.

===========================================

This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/MeditationJun10

===========================================

Meditation has become extremely popular among the most successful people in the world and rightly so: more and more scientific research shows that meditation can greatly improve the health of our mind and body. Regular meditation can help us let go of distracting thoughts that cloud our minds, expand awareness of ourselves, others, and the world as well as reduce stress, increase focus, and improve our abilities to be creative.

With just a few minutes a day, you can begin experiencing the benefits of meditation including:

• Improved mental clarity and focus

• A greater feeling of presence, positivity, and compassion

• Higher energy levels and better sleep

• Increased creativity and ability to manage change

• Greater sense of balance in life and work

In Meditation 101: Learn How to Increase Presence, Focus, and Creativity, you will learn a diverse set of meditation techniques that will allow you to access a state of stillness, self-awareness, and sense of calm. You will learn how to prepare your body for meditation and be guided through a series of techniques that will build a foundation for establishing your own regular meditation practice. After each technique, there will be time to reflect about your experience in order to gain a personal awareness about methods that can be applied on an on-going basis to reduce stress, increase tranquility, and inspire rejuvenation.

WHAT YOU’LL LEARN

• A diverse set of meditation techniques for creating stillness in the mind

• How to use meditation to increase focus, self-awareness, and creativity

• Strategies for developing a space of calm to allow ideas hiding in the depths of your mind to bubble to the surface

• Tips for carrying forward a regular meditation practice

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR  

Professionals, entrepreneurs, and anyone looking to reduce stress, increase focus and creativity, and experience more tranquility in their lives.

INSTRUCTOR BIO

Jenn was lucky enough to be introduced to meditation as a child and has been practicing for over 17 years. As an early adolescent, Jenn began teaching monthly meditation courses for young children in Boston, and for the past 6 years has led meditation retreats for children, teens, families, and adults throughout the East Coast and Midwest. Jenn’s regular meditation practice allows her to manage and enjoy her busy travel and work schedule as well as the rush of New York City living. By day, Jenn manages East Coast and Midwest Chapters at buildOn, an education and service-based nonprofit that runs after school community service programs in low-resource communities and builds schools in remote communities around the globe. Previously, she worked at Seeds of Peace as their External Relations Manager where she managed online fundraising and communications, led a vast volunteer network of young professionals in New York City, and organized an international walkathon call Bridges to Peace. She also managed the Peace Market, a 1500+ event that raised over $300,000 annually. Throughout her nonprofit career and volunteer work, she has also developed curricula and lesson plans for teaching meditation, human rights, women’s empowerment, civic engagement, literacy, and leadership.

You can learn more about BuildOn here and Jenn’s background here.

SPACE PARTNER


The Bard MBA (@BardMBA) in Sustainability is one of a select few graduate programs globally that fully integrates sustainability into a core business curriculum. At Bard, students work in collaborative teams learning how to build businesses and not-for-profit organizations that combine economic, environmental, and social objectives into an integrated bottom line that creates not only healthier businesses, but also a more sustainable world. Graduates of the Bard MBA will transform existing companies, start their own, and pioneer a new paradigm of doing business that meets human needs, protects and restores the Earth's systems, and treats all stakeholders with justice and respect.


Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor
results.name: BSC Class: Meditation 101 - Learn How to Increase Presence, Focus & Creativity

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, May 27th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!


The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The June session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (May 27th - June 17th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)


Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (May 27th - June 17th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (May 26th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevators to the 2nd Floor & make a left. We have the entire studio loft space, complete with brand new, clean rooms, hardwood floors, mirrors, 12’ ceiling, A/C, & sound system.
results.name: Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino Classes!

results.description:
Hey New York eCommerce / Magento Meetup Fans,

Did you know?

80% of all adults now own a smartphone according to TechCrunch Magazine

50% of eCommerce traffic is coming from mobile

Mobile Digital Commerce is outpacing PC growth rates; therefore is is quintessential to learn about the how the advertising industry is shifting towards mobile/tablet with number of smartphone users at an all time high.

Mike Basch will speak about the Rise of Rich Media and how that will help drive your  eCommerce sales:

-Rich media’s role in the transition to mobile

-User acquisition using mobile for your eCommerce Site

-Why Spotad got into the marketplace of mobile advertising

-How to attain customers for your eCommerce site/app using mobile customizable add layouts

-How to target and optimize to your audience on mobile.

More about Mike Basch:

Having launched his career at the young age of 8 selling Lemonade for 25 cents a cup on the corner of his street in LA, he retains a hunger for business for as long as he can remember. With a background consisting of running over 20 coffee shops, building a global sourcing business, and finally landing in mobile ad tech, Michael knows how to build businesses across multiple industries and categories.

As it pertains to Spotad, Michael first got involved as an investor in the initial seed round in Mid-2013.  After being an active investor for a year, in Mid-2014, joined the business full-time, launching the US office--where they are looking to move the company headquarters to by end of 2015. You can connect with him on Linkedin here.

More about Spotad:

Spotad has an expertise in user acquisition as it pertains to mobile/tablet advertising, specifically for apps and e-commerce sites. In the rapidly growing world of advertising, Rich Media ads are the new spots everyone wants to tap into, while technology has been an obstacle for most advertisers. SpotAd removes this obstacle by using unique proprietary framework that enables every brand owner and marketers to deliver it’s own rich media ad in minutes.

To visit Spotad's Website: Spotad

The Meetup Structure:

7:00 - Short Networking

7:30 - We would love to hear 30 second of something about you from all our members

8:00 -Mike will be presenting with Q&A

8:35-9:30 We will be having networking  (For any Netsuite & Magento eCommerce related questions Sam Baron & Mai Erne from Hara Partners will be there to answer them)

Hope to see you all there!

Your fearless eCommerce leader,

Chanah

This Meetup is sponsored Hara Partners.

Check our Hara Partners:Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram pages!

results.name: How Mobile Advertising and Rich Media will drive your eCommerce Sales

results.description:
Out in the cold Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Rhode Island, lies the remains of what was once a feared and mighty hunter. Its's not a fish or shark, for that matter its not even a marine creature. It's what men feared the most when they went to sea aboard their vessel back in the World War II years. It's a German Submarine called a U-Boat. The U-853 was the last German submarine sunk in World War II. She was sunk with all hands just minutes before World War II ended. The once mighty hunter feared by all who put to sea, now lies in 130 feet of water off the coast of Block Island, Rhode Island, her grave marked only by a circle on the nautical charts, DANGER Unexploded Depth Charges, May 1945. 

Captain Bill Palmer will show us his extensive research on this historical shipwreck and show an awesome video detailing the inside of this magnificent submarine.  If time allows, we might even get to talk about the USS Bass which also lies in the waters of Block Island. 

About the Speaker:

Captain Palmer is a licensed Coast Guard Captain with over three decades of practical experience in New England waters. He runs his vessel , The  Thunderfish (www.thunderfishcharters.com) out of Mystic Shipyards in CT, and is committed to providing high quality, reasonably priced adventure packages to the individual who dares to challenge the Ocean with a variety of Shipwreck tours and even Shark Cage Adventure Trips 

He has over 30 years of experience diving wrecks along the eastern seaboard. As well as being a dive instructor specializing in advanced wreck diving, he is an avid historian and underwater videographer. He produces numerous videos on wrecks, wreck diving, and fishing. Some of his credits include C.P.T.V., Discovery Channel, A&E, and Times Mirror. He is well known for his lectures and presentations around the east coast. He is an associate member of the Boston Sea Rovers and a member of the American Society of Oceanographers.
results.name: This Wed :  “U-853 -The Last Battle of the Atlantic”  by Captain Bill Palmer

results.description:
“Squink”—BotFactory’s desktop circuit factory—promises electrical engineers, hobbyists and hackers the ability to quickly build and test a circuit, lowering the manufacturing time from 10 days to 30 minutes, as well as the manufacturing cost from US$250 to US$5 or less.

These are exciting times we are living in, join us at MakerBar, as we host our special guest(s) BotFactory; watch with us as they demonstrate their desktop circuit factory "Squink" in action, and answer some questions from our audience members. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eMM96VztQYM

“Squink" is a personal circuit factory,” said Carlos Ospina, BotFactory co-founder and CTO.  “It lowers the barrier for hardware design and fabrication. "Squink" can be used by experienced designers to accelerate their development cycle, and it empowers communities with limited access to fabrication services. When some say that hardware is “hard”, our technology is here to show it doesn’t need to be.” 

Building electronics has always been a compromise between cost, flexibility and time. "Squink" was created to provide all three, anywhere and to everyone.


"Squink" replaces the usual soldering operation with conductive glue, meaning even young students or makers who have not mastered the difficult skill of delicate SMD soldering can easily prototype electronics from a file. It prints on a variety of substrates - even flexible ones for all your new wearables ideas you been dreaming about. And it includes a 'pick n place' feature that allows "Squink" to place all your parts in the right place, in the proper orientation, the first time, every time.  Simplifying the process of building circuits and allowing you to focus more on other tasks while you wait for your personal circuit factory to produce your boards.   

-From an idea to a circuit – in minutes...

You can access your "Squink" through USB, Ethernet cable, or Wifi. YES, wifi that's right. After you create or download your circuit design files (GERBER), upload them to "Squink" and it will walk you through a three step process. You can also use regular PNG files if you feel artistic! Press Print, sit back and watch the magic happen....

 As always seating will be on a first come, first serve bases, so don't wait reserve your spot today seating will be limited...


This event is free and open to the public.   It's also a great time to stop in and see what the MakerBar is all about. Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.  MakerBar is a 503(c) NJ Non-Profit Organization, consider donating today... All donations are tax deductible.....

Doors open at 7PM-till ?????

****Minors (under 18) must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.****
results.how_to_find_us: 1-855-MAKERBAR and we'll help you find the way
results.name: DEMO NIGHT "SQUINK" by BOTFACTORY Desktop Circuit Factory

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

 

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

 

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

 

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

 

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

 

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

 

Coach Frank

D&D Encounters is a great event for new and seasoned players! Using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and being formatted for casual play through WotC Adventurers League, each session lasts about 3 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week.

This season players will start at 1st level and will be leveling up throughout the season (feel free to contact the event host for the current level!) We encourage new players who want to make custom characters to come to the store early (any time after 6:00PM) or attend one of our D&D Player Primers. Pre-generated characters will be available!

Abolish an ancient evil threatening devastation in this adventure for the world’s greatest roleplaying game!

Called by the Elder Elemental Eye to serve, four corrupt prophets have risen from the depths of anonymity to claim mighty weapons with direct links to the power of the elemental princes. Each of these prophets has assembled a cadre of cultists and creatures to serve them in the construction of four elemental temples of lethal design. It is up to adventurers from heroic factions such as the Emerald Enclave and the Order of the Gauntlet to discover where the true power of each prophet lay, and dismantle it before it comes boiling up to obliterate the Realms.
results.name: 21st season of D&D Encounters, Elemental Evil: The Princes of the Apocalypse!

results.description:
It’s the lesser-known half of that hyphenated region, Languedoc-Roussillon.

Languedoc-Roussillon, in southern France, is often thought of as a single region, but the two areas are distinctly different.  Languedoc is thoroughly French, its vineyards spread out over a broad coastal plain.  Roussillon, which borders Spain, considers itself Catalan and grows vines in terraced vineyards in the Pyrenees foothills.  Languedoc has long been synonymous with basic French table wine, while Roussillon has always been best known for fortified vins doux naturels—French equivalents of port from the Banyuls and Maury appellations, and Muscat- and Grenache Blanc-based sweet wines from Rivesaltes. 

The unfortified table wines of Roussillon are enjoying a higher reputation these days, largely thanks to an influx of new winemakers who recognized the potential of the region’s schistous hillsides, which are not unlike those of Priorat across the border in Spain. 

Unlike Languedoc, which has numerous appellations named after local villages, Roussillon AOCs for dry wines are limited to Côtes du Roussillon, Côtes du Roussillon-Villages, Collioure, and the recently created Maury Sec. 

Côtes du Roussillon – This large appellation covers the eastern half of the Pyrénées-Orientales, from the Mediterranean coast to the eastern edge of the Pyrenees mountains.  Per AOC regulations, Côtes du Roussillon reds must be made from at least three different grape varieties, with Syrah and/or Mourvèdre constituting at least 30 percent.  Grenache is the most planted variety, and there’s still a fair amount of less-favored Carignan (which cannot contribute more than 60 percent to the blend).  The designation Côtes du Roussillon-Villages is reserved for (theoretically) superior wines of the region and is limited to the hilly northern third of Roussillon.  Four villages are allowed to append their names to the appellation title.   

White wines constitute just 4 percent of production, yet they can be some of the region’s most interesting wines, usually made from aromatic Grenache Blanc and Maccabeu (better known as Rioja’s Viura grape), and often treated to oak aging. 

Côtes Catalanes – This is a catch-all Vin de Pays/IGP category that covers wines that do not adhere to Côtes du Roussillon regulations.  This is not necessarily an indication of lesser quality—a superior wine that contains fewer than three varieties or contains less than 30 percent Syrah/Mourvèdre will be bottled as Côtes Catalanes.

Collioure – This is an attractive seaside town near the Spanish border that is best known as an artists’ colony—Matisse, Picasso, and Braque, among others, all spent time here.  But it also produces a fairly rare red wine from the same vineyards that yield fortified Banyuls.  Syrah, Grenache, and Mourvèdre (the last grown exclusively for the dry table wine) must make up 60 percent of the blend.  Yields are low here, and there is a maximum alcohol level permitted (15 percent), perhaps an indication of the extreme ripeness achieved in this warm climate. 

Maury Sec – The northern Roussillon equivalent of Collioure is the new appellation Maury Sec, made in the same region and from the same grape varieties as sweet, fortified Maury.  The dominant grape is Grenache, which must make up between 60 and 80 percent of the blend.

We’ll be trying a white Côtes du Roussillon, made from barrel-fermented Marsanne, Roussanne, and the more local Grenache Blanc and Maccabeu, and a red Côtes du Roussillon-Villages made by famed Rhône Valley winemaker Chapoutier. 

Then under the Côtes Catalanes designation, we’ll try a rustic white blend of Grenache Blanc, Maccabeu, and the little-known Carignan Blanc, and an all-Syrah red that is said to rival those of the northern Rhône.  Plus another Côtes Catalanes made mostly from old-vines Grenache by California winery Orin Swift (of “Prisoner” fame—they actually sold off the Prisoner label in order to invest in vineyards abroad, including this one in Roussillon).  This will be an interesting exercise in blind tasting—can we pick out the American-made bottle?  (Jancis Robinson, while mostly praising the wine, complains that it tastes more of Napa than of Roussillon.)

Then a well-priced Collioure, made organically from Grenache, Carignan, Mourvèdre, and Syrah, and an even greater bargain from Maury Sec—a 95-rated Syrah/Mourvèdre/Grenache blend. 

A Roussillon tasting would not be complete without including a vin doux naturel.  As a bonus dessert wine, I’ll be including a Rivesaltes Ambré, a sweet, fortified Grenache Blanc that acquired its deep amber color from spending 14 years maturing in barrel. 

We’ll be meeting at Plates in Larchmont, which allows BYOB on Wednesday.

http://platesonthepark.com/

2012 Laguerre Le Ciste Blanc Côtes du Roussillon  $17

From Chambers Street Wines:  Eric Laguerre's "Le Ciste," (named after a flowering bush in and around his vineyards) is certainly one of the most distinctive whites of the Roussillon. Grown in Eric's high-elevation vineyards on acidic soils of decomposed granite, the wine is made from Marsanne, Roussanne, Rolle (Vermentino), Grenache Blanc and Maccabeu. Yields are about 20 Hl/Ha, harvesting is by hand in small baskets, fermentation (wild yeasts) and aging is in small barrels. Complex aromas of lemon oil, thyme, hay and white fruits—a lovely melange with contributions from each variety. The plate is dense, stony and saline with herbal, citrus and white fruit flavors. The finish is long with mineral acids. Complex and distinctive as a young wine, this will be best with a few years of cellaring. Really a Grand Cru of the Roussillon and a great value! 

2012 Domaine Vinci Coyade Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes  $42

75% Maccabeu, 15% Carignan Blanc, 10% Grenache Blanc.  From Kermit Lynch:  Olivier Varichon and Emmanuelle Vinci craft their fascinating wines here from what must be some of the most rustic vineyards on the planet. Their parcels lie at altitude on steep slopes where only gnarly old vines and the most resilient garrigue manage to dig roots into the rugged, rocky soil. The couple works their few small plots by hand, adamantly shunning chemical products anywhere near their prized vineyards. “Coyade,” a blend of the native Maccabeu with Grenache Blanc and the rare Carignan Blanc, delivers intense matchstick minerality backed by electric citrus and fleshy texture. Completing its malolactic fermentation and aging in neutral barrels, this substantial white deserves to be decanted.

2013 Domaine de Bila-Haut Haut Côtes du Roussillon-Villages Latour de France Occultum Lapidem  $32

Wine Advocate 94 – Ripe, voluptuous, and textured, the translucent purple-colored 2013 Cotes du Roussillon Villages Latour de France Occultum Lapidem comes from the schist soils around the village of Latour de France. A blend of 50% Syrah, 40% Grenache and 10% Carignan that was harvested on September 15 and aged all in concrete tanks, it’s a fabulous wine that offers elegant notes of red and black raspberries, roasted herbs, pepper, melted licorice, and asphalt. These flow to a medium to full-bodied 2013 that has a full, layered mid-palate, beautiful fruit, fine tannin, and a classically focused, dry finish. It continues to freshen up in the glass, has integrated acidity and lots of class.

2012 Gilles Troullier Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes De-La  $35

Wine Advocate 94 –A new cuvée from Gilles, the 2012 Côtes Catalanes De-La (which translates to "Here and There") is sourced from 25-year-old Syrah vines and the granite soils of Lesquerde and Trevillach (which is right next to Boreal). It offers a gorgeous, Northern Rhône-like bouquet of blackberry, raspberry, violets, mint, and liquid rock that flows to a medium to full-bodied, elegant, and seamless feel on the palate. Possessing first-rate purity, integrated acidity and ample, polished tannin, it will shine for over a decade.

2009 Orin Swift D66 Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes  $40

Jancis Robinson 15.5/20 – 80% Grenache, 12% Carignan, and 8% Syrah from old vines with very low yields. Very dark, almost port-like look. Almost port-like taste too. SO sweet! Very clever winemaking indeed. The tannins are wonderfully supple until the slight acid and hit of schist on the end, and the fruit so luscious. But why does it have to taste so like a red from the Napa Valley rather than the Agly Valley? Local character seems smothered to me.

2010 Traginer Collioure  $22

From Chambers Street Wines:  From Grenache, Carignan, Mourvèdre, and Syrah grown organically on the steep, schist vineyards of Domaine de Traginer, our favorite producer of Banyuls and Collioure. The 2010 Cuvée Vieille Foudre shows deep aromas of ripe red currant and cherry liqueur, dried herbs, earth, and cocoa; the palate is dense and round but with a core of saline mineral under the ripe plum and cherry fruit, with earthy acidity in the long finish. Delicious now with a daube Niçoise or steak, this should cellar beautifully, becoming wonderfully soft and complex, for five to ten years.

2013 Chateau Saint-Roch Kerbuccio Maury Sec  $22

Wine Advocate 95 – One of the most incredible values I've tasted in a long, long time, the jaw-dropping good 2013 Kerbuccio Maury Sec (this is a new appellation dedicated to dry wines from Maury) is 40% Syrah, 30% Mourvèdre, and 30% Grenache, all from the black schist soils of Maury, that spent eight months in concrete tank prior to being bottled unfiltered. Its inky purple color is followed by fabulous aromas and flavors of crème de cassis, violets, crushed rocks, and licorice. Full-bodied, seamless and incredibly textured, all while staying fresh and pure, it's an off-the-charts Roussillon that will drink well for 5-8 years, possibly longer.

BONUS

1999 Domaine Cazes Rivesaltes Ambré 

Wine Advocate 92 – Rendered entirely from Grenache Blanc, the 2013-bottled Cazes 1999 Rivesaltes Ambré offers a riveting nose of candied lemon rind, glazed pineapple, brown sugar, pork rind, toasted pecan, floral extracts, wood smoke, and ocean breeze. Incisively zest and citric, piquantly nutty, briny, and alkaline on its expansive and lusciously viscous palate, this supplies ample counterpoint to its undeniable sweetness, even as flavors of nougat, caramel, and honey emerge to prominence. There are nectarous purity and polish here as well as formidable complexity.
results.name: Roussillon

results.description:
Let's meet again for a casual conversation with Gerardo Laster, Localization Lead @Citrix, who will share his experience embracing Agile localization : what is it, why they adopted it, what are the operational and supply chain challenges of adopting this method, and the Citrix experience overcoming them. 

I will also share my experiences in the past 3 months localizing @Meetup where we have "very frequent updates of 100 words or more" and where the product is constantly evolving. 

Interesting read before the Meetup:

http://www.gala-global.org/galaxy/features/agile-globalization-next-big-opportunity-localization-industry 

Looking forward to meeting up!

Coralie- Senior Localization Specialist @Meetup
results.name: The challenges of Agile Localization with Citrix & Meetup

results.description:
What is a civic hacknight?

This is a weekly project night is for technologists, designers, developers, data scientists, map makers, and activists who are working on "civic technology" projects. Consider this to be a study hall or office hours to improve you and the city.

This night is for those who want to: * work on projects
* start a new project, or find one to join
* get feedback from experts
* learn about tools for local empowerment, open data, and open government

Bring your laptop, power supply, ideas, projects, maps, data, and questions. Collectively, we will try to answer them.

-=-=-

Hacknight resources:

For first timers trying to get the most out of the night, you should bring your laptop, watch Civic Hacking 101, Civic Hacking 102, and review our projects page.

* Working Groups - Developers' Corner, CityGram.NYC, City Record Online, & MTA Service Alerts 
* Data tools: Data.Beta.NYC, data resources, maps, & tools 
* Community projects in process - projects.beta.nyc

-=-=-

Projects & presentations:

We keep the “formal” part of the evening down to a minimum: announcements, meet your neighbor, etc. After, we will have a number of people present, specific projects, and have some skills share / education. 

Community Projects:


* What are YOU working on? Plug it into this event's comments section!

Featured Community Project:

Betch!

Are you tired of people getting millions of dollars for stupid app ideas? Are you frustrated with stupid decisions made by the government? Are you angry with the Patriarchy? Are you just upset that people don't replace the toilet paper when the roll is out? 

Well Betch about it!


Betch is an app that lets you Betch with other Betches and new Betches. It was created as a company to unite people betching about similar things in similar places. The Betch team is in the process of building the app and want your help! They will be at the Hack Night on June 10th at Civic Hall. Danielle Tomson will lead a design thinking-esque workshop and general discussion about how to build Betch in anticipation of a crowdfunding campaign. They want your help!  

If you are interested in making an awesome app with people who love civic engagement, parody, and technology, email Danielle at [masked] and go to http://betch.city/ or tweet at them on 

@betchnow


(BetaNYC's Organizer note: Betch is a cultural statement against the status quo. BetaNYC seeks to foster "apps against the patriarchy." If you are interested in other apps that will change your perspective, check out "Jailbreak the Patriarchy."

-=-=-

Event Partners:

The Code for America Brigade program is an international network of people committed to using their voices and hands, in collaboration with local governments, to make their cities better.

Microsoft Civic aims to collaboratively address the most pressing community challenges through the hyper-local creation, deployment, and evangelism of civic technology.

Accela provides civic engagement solutions for government. Accela’s solutions uniquely address the diverse needs of their constituents by making publicly available information more accessible. The Accela Civic Platform includes solutions for land management, asset management, licensing and case management, legislative management, right of way management, citizen relationship management, recreation and resource management, environmental health and safety.

-=-=-

Note about the venue:

You should RSVP with the name that appears on a photo ID. In order to give building security an RSVP list, RSVPs will close at 4:00 PM the day of the event. If you miss this deadline, most of the time security is nice and will let you in.

BetaNYC is committed to hosting safe and open events for all. By attending this event you are committing yourself to BetaNYC's Code of Conduct and Anti-Harassment Policy.
results.name: Civic Hacknight at Civic Hall

group.name: #BetaNYC, NYC's open data, open gov, & civic tech community

results.description:
Join us for Summer Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with at least one other player present and should be a Hudson County resident with ID.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible (3 courts).

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game. And remember to bring plenty of water!

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

 

*Free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as a guest of the resident players to avoid a possible $10 fee to play.
results.how_to_find_us: Be sure to check the rsvp list for other player's photos. I will send my contact info before the event.
results.name: Wednesday Evening Tennis at Lincoln Park

BeCOMe aka Brick City Open Mic is a space for people to "become" who/what they want to be.  It is a lifelong process and so we are reaching out to all creative types to join us.  The goal is to truly be an "open" mic welcome to all kinds of talents, artists, and entertainers, of all skill levels.

This is also an open jam, an open floor, and an open forum.  Please, bring your instruments, your thoughts, your feelings, your jokes, and your friends.

We have PA and a house band, Lot on 7th.  So far, I think we have done a good job in creating a welcoming and supportive atmosphere.  Hope to see you next month!

Signups start at 700pm.

Mic opens at 730pm.

We now request a donation of $1. You will not be denied entry if you do not contribute. You are also welcome to give more. Thanks!

The next meeting of the LGBT Babyboomers group will be Wednesday, June 10 at the Florham Park Diner, 182 Ridgedale Ave in Florham Park at 7:00pm. We have a room reserved and feel free to order dinner from their extensive menu. Our guest speaker will be Bill Singer of the law firm Singer & Fedun. Bill has been providing legal services to LGBT adults and their families for forty years. He will be talking about Wills, Trusts and Living Wills. The information he gives us will be beneficial to everyone. Feel free to bring guests and to share this information with anyone who you feel would be interested.

 Please rsvp BY SUNDAY, JUNE 7.

Future Meetings at different venues will include topics such as:

 

Setting life goals
Power of attorney
Finding a healthcare representative
What to do when you no longer can live alone
Being a care giver and receiving care
Obamacare, Medicare and Social Security
Financial Planning
Long Term Healthcare Insurance
Independent Living, Assisted Living and Nursing Homes
Outreach to LGBT Seniors

This powerful interactive course is designed to empower you with tools to overcome blocks in the precarious world of dating. Bringing awareness to certain aspects of what happened in the last relationship and how it affects you today is imperative to moving into a healthy relationship:

This is what I will cover:

• We will explore the frustrations of dating

• We will get off the merry-go-round of frustration and forever "1st dates" with the tools I will give you to move forward

• Learn the one easy technique that will end the frustration with dating


• We will explore ways to REMOVE the baggage so you can move forward with confidence and a clean slate

• We will leave with HOPE, a new outlook and perspective on dating and relationships

My name is Rachel Devine, I am the author of "Lessons from the Needle in a Haystack, Become a Magnet for True Love." This is a valuable handbook for dating. I am also a motivational speaker. I do talks in public libraries as well as singles groups. I am a group facilitator and I invite you to join me as we explore a different way of seeing our last relationship and recognize the lessons.

Why can't we get along like animals do? Learn the valuable secret to all of the confusion in the world of dating.

Join me for a fun complimentary interactive informative course that is guaranteed to bring about positive results.
results.name: COMPLIMENTARY - HOW TO TURN DATING FRUSTRATIONS INTO A WIN - LEARN THE TECHNIQUE

Join business coach, speaker, and author of #1 Amazon bestseller Michael Mapes for this complimentary webinar to discover the exact wealth creating secrets you need to grow your business, make more money, enroll more clients and help a lot more people. 

This workshop is about helping you discover the deeply embedded and often hidden reasons why you aren't succeeding in your business so that you can more fully embody your visionary purpose.

In this powerful content-packed workshop, I'll show you how to implement these essential success ingredients into your business so that you can:

• Enroll clients quickly and easily 

• Make a much bigger impact through your work

• Double or Triple your Income 

• Charge more than ever before and have clients actually say YES 

• Release fears around failure, success, and making money 

• Fill your practice with tons of ideal clients

• Serve the world in a bigger way 

• And, step into running a business that gives you more time, more freedom, and more enjoyment 

If you're ready to play bigger, to serve more people, to make more money, and to step more fully into your purpose as an entrepreneur then say YES to yourself right now and join me at Wealth Creation Secrets.

Michael is an intuitive business mentor and author of #1 Amazon bestseller: The Conscious Entrepreneur’s Guide to Creating Wealth.

He helps conscious entrepreneurs make more money, get more clients, help more people, and step into their role as visionary leaders. 

His unique intuitive approach to coaching enables you to quickly overcome obstacles that keep you from attracting ideal clients, and owning a thriving monetized business.

Michael’s philosophy is simple: using the practical power of intuition, anyone can massively grow their business, reach their ideal audience, and make a big impact on the world. Learn more at http://www.michaelmapes.org

The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.


Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join Kimberly Brown for tonight's meditation. Learn how to bring practice into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

This class will include guided instruction and time for group discussion and connecting with the community.


Kimberly Brown is a Meditation Teacher and the Executive Director of The Interdependence Project. She studies Tibetan and American Buddhism, and her teachers include Lama Norlha Rinpoche and Sharon Salzberg. Her work and teachings emphasize the ways in which meditation, mindfulness, and ethics are shared among all traditions of awakening. You can reach her at [masked].


Mindful Astoria meets every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.  Details at their Meetup Group. 


Suggested donation is $5-$10 at the door, but no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening community with you all!

results.description:
Meeting place again at 120 Bay. Take Two of this meeting, with hopefully a larger, better organized group in a more organized setting.

For our next meeting, with all the attention the presidential race is getting, I thought we would start off with a straw poll endorsement. This group is about Staten Island, but all politics is local, and organizing here in our hometown for a presidential candidate is no less important than our own local politics. The straw poll should only take a few minutes. Also perhaps a discussion on the Trans-Pacific Partnership and Fast Track, and making sure all of our members are writing, e-mailing, and calling our elected representatives to demand they side with the American worker against the corporate elites and stop Fast Track and the TPP. Police brutality is also an issue of obvious concern, meeting right down the street from where Eric Garner was killed by out-of-control cops. Afterward I thought we would discuss some of the issues others brought up at our first meeting, in particular the destruction of Mount Manresa and if anyone has any ideas about how to stop it (already there has been significant demolition but it's not too late to save what is left and prevent 250 condos from being built there instead of the beautiful greenery that is there now). Any ideas about how to catch the attention of Mayor Bill de Blasio to intervene before it is too late are welcome. Also we have a bunch of new members so we are still in an introductory phase.
results.name: Straw Poll Endorsement, the TPP, Police Brutality, & Saving Mount Manresa

results.description:
Hi all,
For June let's read Things We Set on Fire by Deborah Reed...
"A series of tragedies brings Vivvie's young grandchildren into her custody, and her two estranged daughters back under one roof. Jackson, Vivvie’s husband, was shot and killed thirty years ago, and the ramifications have splintered the family into their own isolated remembrances and recriminations. Sisters Elin and Kate fought mercilessly in childhood and have avoided each other for years. Elin seems like the last person to watch her sister convalesce after an attempted suicide. But Elin has her own reasons for coming to Kate's side and will soon discover Kate’s own staggering needs.

This deeply personal, hauntingly melancholy look at the damages families inflict on each other—and the healing that only they can provide—is filled with flinty, flawed, and complex people stumbling toward some kind of peace. Like Elizabeth Strout and Kazuo Ishiguro, Deborah Reed understands a story, and its inhabitants reveal themselves in the subtleties: the space between the thoughts, the sigh behind the smile, and the unreliable lies people tell themselves that ultimately reveal the deepest truths."
results.name: June Meetup (Things We Set on Fire)

group.name: Young Women's Book and Wine Club

results.description:
We will be discussing the contents of The World Peace Diet, Chapters 1 and 2: "Foods Power" & "Our Culture's Roots"

• Chapter 1: Food's Power; "The most violent weapon on earth is the fork".  [Gandhi] What does food mean to us in our busy culture? It is the most intimate thing we do. How can something so pedestrian be so powerful? 

• Chapter 2: Our culture's Roots; "As long as men massacre animals, they will kill each other. He who sows the seeds of murder and pain cannot reap joy and love" [Pythagoras] How did we get here, to a culture that is so meat obsessed, yet cannot bare to see how our food is harvested. Where did we depart from our innate and childlike sense of compassion toward animals.

The World Peace Diet provides a transformative perspective on the multiple consequences of the food choices we make (or are made for us)—not just in terms of personal physical health, but also environmental health, cultural well-being, economic well-being, and alignment with our ethical and spiritual values.

If you have read the book, this study group will be a good forum for sharing sections that meant something to you, seeking clarity on more challenging sections through open discussion, and sharing how you have been effected by your food choices.

If you have not read the book but are an ethical and environmentally compassionate individual, and would like to explore ways to live more in alignment with your values, I think you will enjoy the discussion and be a valuable contributor to the deep discussions that will inevitably come from discussing the text.

Remaining chapters will be discussed in the following weeks.
results.name: Let's discuss The World Peace Diet - Chapters 1 & 2

CLASS DESCRIPTION

Each of the classes in this 9-week course will be 2 1/2 hours. You will continue to learn and hone basic and advanced improv techniques, continue learning long form improv and there will be two musical improv sessions with improv pianist, John Zych.

At the conclusion of the class you will perform two shows at the theater at The Creek and The Cave, a comedy and improv theater located in Long Island City. There is also a bar and a restaurant and guests are welcome to bring food and drink into the theater.

A safe, supportive and nurturing atmosphere is created in which each student can be spontaneous, uninhibited and more comfortable with verbal, emotional and physical expression.

results.description:
Nothing grabs a Brooklynite’s attention better than a beer garden with 6,000 square feet of airy space, a hundred flowing tap lines, and homemade bratwurst from an open kitchen. Resting on the upper edge of McCarren Park, the massive Spritzenhaus beckons day-trippers and neighbors alike with its spacious 110 ft bar, long communal benches, and seasonal sidewalk seating. The 25-deep tap list centers on German drafts and domestic craft brews, all of which can be found pouring from four different stations. That’s a lot of beer, but Bavarian pretzels and wood-fired pizza soak it up admirably. Park proximity and open windows make for ideal Spring drinking, but when the weather’s less than hospitable, thirsty visitors can sit by the brick fireplace and ponder deep thoughts, like which beer to get next.

Fact: Spritzenhaus means "fire station" in German.
results.how_to_find_us: Sign handmade in Greenpoint!
results.name: Grab a stein, a bratwurst and a seat at this massive GPT beer hall

results.description:
Be aware: There is no entry system at Mark's apartment, so knock on the door or a window to the left of the door, and if no one answers, call[masked]-3368.

This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending.  Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group.

Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday, eleven days prior to the Meetup. On that day, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order, with a link to the Google Drive folder where the stories live. That list will also appear under Discussions and will be edited as changes occur.

To submit, Email your submission to [masked]

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam

MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.

Send to [masked]

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.how_to_find_us: Use the upper entrance. Near Nostrand (between that and Bedford), about a 5-10 minute walk from the Nostrand stops on the A, C, and G trains, steps away from the Gates stop on the B42 bus and the Nostrand stop on the B52 bus
results.name: Brad's Novel Group

results.description:
Destroy, She Said by Marguerite Duras:


In this classic novel by the best-selling author of The Lover, erotic intrigue masks a chillingly deceptive form of madness. Elisabeth Alione is convalescing in a hotel in rural France when she meets two men and another woman. The sophisticated dalliance among the four serves to obscure an underlying violence, which, when the curtain of civilization is drawn aside, reveals in her fellow guests a very contemporary, perhaps even new, form of insanity.
results.how_to_find_us: look for the book
results.name: Meetup Forty Six: Destroy, She Said

group.name: The Williamsburg Modern Lit Book Club

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

results.description: At the moment our mind is like a candle flame flickering from the winds of our constantly moving thoughts. Our mind is impossible to control, and therefore we experience problems and difficulties. However, in this series, we will discover that our mind has vast potential, and is capable of limitless love, wisdom and joy. We will gain experience of the meditation, called clarity of mind, that helps us to connect to this potential. This practice creates the causes and conditions for us to experience a special bliss of concentration.

results.description:
Experience a Spiritual Tool
That Can Help Transform Your Life!

 

No matter what your spiritual background or faith, you are invited to learn a simple technique that can help transform your life. Join us and others in your community to experience spiritual insights gained by singing HU—a love song to God.

Singing HU can:
• Expand your awareness
• Help you release mental and emotional stresses
• Heal a broken heart
• Offer solace during times of grief
• Help you experience divine love


We sing HU together for about 20 minutes followed by five minutes of quiet contemplation. Light refreshment and conversation follow. Please join us—your friends and family are invited, too. We hope to see you there.

Every Second Wednesday,  7:30 – 8:30 pm

ECKANKAR Center
11 Park Street, Montclair, NJ
There is on-street parking and two municipal parking lots in the area. Please pay particular attention to meters and parking signs. (Metered parking is free evenings after 7pm and on Sundays.)


For more information about HU check out www.HearHU.org and MiraclesinYourLife.org. For information on other events being held throughout the state, visit www.eckankar-nj.org.

 

Presented by the Satsang Society of New Jersey, Inc., a Chartered Affiliate of ECKANKAR, Religion of the Light and Sound of God and hosted by the Center for Spiritual Living North Jersey.

The terms ECKANKAR, ECK, EK, MAHANTA, SOUL TRAVEL and VAIRAGI, among others are trademarks of ECKANKAR. Copyright ©2012 ECKANKAR. All rights reserved. ECKANKAR PO Box 2000, Chanhassen, MN[masked] USA. Visit Eckankar’s Web site at www.eckankar.org.

results.description:
Let's have our first meeting enjoying a small *meal at the Land & Sea Restaurant in Fair Lawn, which has plenty of seating for large groups. We will all have a chance to introduce ourselves and be accepted as Empaths. If you are not an Empath, but love someone who is, we would love to get to know you too!

This is not about making anyone feel embarrassed or singled out. We just want to have the chance to know a little bit about one another so that we can show our appreciation for who you are! We realize, some may be shy, some may feel nervous, and some may experience social anxiety. Just know that this is a safe environment, where you will not be judged or condemned. We want you to feel accepted and appreciated.

The best thing about this group, is that we do not encourage clicks or seclusion. We may gravitate towards certain individuals that we feel a strong connection with, but, we do not want to isolate anyone. So, be prepared to learn something about everyone.

*Meals are not free. Please be prepared to pay for yourself.

results.description:
JUNE 10, 8 PM --  Drew Sachs presents AKA AL PARKER, Act I, the story of Gay adult film icon Al Parker and how he not only transformed the industry with his dark, masculine looks and rugged sexuality, but also redefined what it meant to be Gay.

Drew Sachs, is a playwright who received his MFA. in Dramatic Writing from Carnegie Mellon University where he studied with playwrights Tina Howe, Lanie Robertson and Milan Stitt.   Drew's been was a semi-finalist at the Eugene O'Neill Conference with his work  I AM NOT BREAKFAST as well as a semi-finalist with his play HADRIAN'S FAVORITE.  Drew’s work CHRIS SQUARED was part of the Boston Theater Marathon IX. Other productions of his plays include, ANYA, A BOROUGH PARK ANTIGONE and THE KNOCK, both produced by The Drilling CompaNY. His play WHO ARE YOU DANCING WITH NOW? received honorable mention at the Kennedy Center Play Writing Competition. STABBING O.J., a play focusing on the Anita Bryant scandals of the 70’s, was produced at Queens College and directed by Susan Einhorn, as part of The College Plays which later went on to the Samuel French Festival. Other works include, MISS UNDERSTANDING, (finalist: Nantucket Short Play Festival), “You Never Miss What You Never Had” (PBS Television). Drew’s, THE THREE RINGS OF CARMEN, a re-telling of Carmen was commissioned and produced by the Lexington School for the Deaf, NY.   Drew is a member of The Dramatist Guild. No playwrights scheduled yet.

https://sites.google.com/site/villageplaywrights/_/rsrc/1433276515089/news/Sachs%20Headshot%20%282%29.jpg?height=200&width=131

June 10, June 17, June 24, July 1, July 8.

In this this 5-session series we you will experience Shamanic Breathwork, a powerful experience that draws on ancient shamanic practices as well as contemporary psycho-spiritual models.  

Through the shamanic Breathwork journey you will have an opportunity to access the "shaman within", clear energetic blockages and emotional patterns that stand in your way of your full self-expression, connect with spirit guides and recognize and heal aspects of your "shadow". 

For more information visit  my website at http://www.simpletruthwithin.com/shamanic-breathwork-series-5-sessions-ny-open-center-june-wednesdays-june-10-july-8-2015-800pm-1000pm/

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in New York?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in Los Angeles.

OneTaste New York is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

We start on time so please arrive fifteen minutes early.

COST TO ATTEND IS $10

For info contact Marissa at[masked] or [masked]

results.description:
Join us for a 45-minute cross-training workout designed to build strength, flexibility and endurance in your running fitness. Each of our workouts is created and led by a certified coach who will take care to ensure you have proper form and get the most out of every session.  

The workout will consist of a fast-paced circuit of  movement exercises and short runs that will help you to develop specific muscles, leaving you with the capacity to be stronger, faster and less prone to injury after only a few sessions. 

Pricing:
For the month of June, all of our cross-training workouts are free to try.
Your first session is always free to try - we want you to know what you’re signing up for. 

Starting in July, one month of unlimited cross-training workouts is available for $30. Two months of unlimited cross-training are yours for only $50. 

Special!
During the month of June, if you purchase one month of unlimited cross-training, we will extend your purchase by a full month (that’s $30 for two months of unlimited cross-training). 


Disclaimer:
All fitness programs come with some risk of injury. By agreeing to participate, you confirm that you’re of adequate fitness that you can comfortably run 3-4 miles at a time. Please let your coach know of any injuries or conditions that may limit your ability to complete this session safely - safety is of primary importance, and your coach will do everything possible to make the workout safe, fun and rewarding. 

- - - - - -

PLEASE TEXT rsvp[masked] - Cathy


Hello Everyone, 

I am offering 2 weeks of free workout, so that is up to 8 classes for free. please watch my video to get an idea of how much fun we can have getting that beach body!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SEfy9XKiqQc

please visit my website: catgarlo.com 

 facebook: CatGarloFitness and see some reviews. Photos and invites on here as well.

https://www.facebook.com/CatGarloFitness

I really hope you take the trial and make some new friends while getting fit in one of the most beautiful places on earth!

NO ONE UPTOWN OFFERS POUND - this is a great opportunity to try something fun and NEW!!!

7a-730am - Pound Rock Out Work out -
730am-8a - HIIT (High Intensity Interval training)
8a-830am - Pound Rock Out Work out (ab work) 
830am-9a - Boot Camp

POUND is a full-body cardio jam session, combining light resistance with constant simulated drumming. The workout fuses cardio, Pilates, isometric movements, plyometrics and Isometric poses into a 45-minute series. Burn between 400 and 900+ calories per hour, strengthen and sculpt infrequently used muscles, and drum your way to a leaner, slimmer physique – all while rocking out to your favorite music!

HIIT, as the name suggests, combines high-intensity, calorie-torching periods of activity with low-intensity recovery periods for an overall duration of as little as 10 minutes each session. Some studies have shown that HIIT burns up to nine times more fat than traditional cardiovascular exercise and keeps your metabolism elevated for more than 24 hours afterwards. This means you are going to keep burning calories long after you have finished exercising.

Boot Camp Workout. This intense circuit keeps your heart rate up, burns calories, and tones your whole body. With these circuits we will use body weight exercises alternating with calisthenics.

you will need to bring, 

Yourself, Sneakers, comfortable clothes.

At least one water bottle (trust me, you’ll need it!) and a towel for all that sweat. If you have one, a heart rate monitor is an awesome fitness tool that instructors and students alike typically use to measure exercise intensity during classes. 

You may want gloves, & a Mat as we are going to get down and dirty, pullups, push ups, planks, knee tucks we are going to have some fun utilizing the swings and monkey bars in the play ground, so dress accordingly and get excited to have some fun while shaping up!!!.

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

• Cleaning Service

• Florist

• Handyman or women

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

results.description:
REGISTER HERE.

This one day event will demonstrate how Passive House can help you make a New York that is built to last.   

The conference will begin with the presentation of two awards: The NY Passive House Pioneer Award to Chris Benedict, Chris Benedict RAand Henry Gifford, Gifford Fuel Savings Inc for their deep commitment to low-energy building, demonstrating the significant potential of Passive House building in New York; and the NY Passive House Hero Award to Mayor Bill de Blasio and the Mayor's Office of Sustainability for building awareness of, and support for, the dramatic energy efficiency measures of Passive House.  The awards will be presented by Josh Fox, director and producer of the award-winning documentary, GASLAND, a film that demonstrates the perils of gas hydrofracking and argues the need for a fossil fuel free, low-energy future.

Mayor Bill de Blasio’s policy to reduce city-wide carbon emissions 80% by 2050 in his plan One City: Built to Last, has set the course for effective climate change mitigation and resilient adaptation. 


Passive House is the one building standard that reliably and affordably delivers deep cuts in energy use proportionate to our climate challenge, while providing increased comfort, indoor health and climate resilience - including net zero and energy positive buildings. 

If you’re a stakeholder in our low-energy building future find out how Passive House is being successfully implemented and ask questions that relate directly to your situation.

REGISTER HERE.

Presentations Include: 

· A Revolution in Building: From Brussels to NYC.  Sebastian Moreno-Vacca, A2M. The Story of Brussels' adoption of mandatory Passive House construction is as much about retrofits as it is new buildings. Learn how they are doing it in Brussels and then doing it right here in NYC's meat-packing district.

·  The Passive House Institute Steps into the Future: The tools and pathways to reach our low-carbon future.  Jessica Grove-Smith, Passive House Institute. Find out the details of the new certification standards for net-zero and energy positive buildings, including new primary energy calculation methodology that are designed to allow your building optimization to have the best climate change mitigation potential.

·  Retrofitting Brownstone Brooklyn to Passive House. Michael Ingui, Baxt Ingui Architects. Cramer Silkworth, Baukraft & Passive House Academy. Kevin Brennan, Association for Energy Affordability. With a dozen Passive House retrofits complete or in progress, this presentation will show the methodology, details and results of this team's transformative efforts in historic New York.

• Passive House Feeling Higher: What it takes to make a high-rise Passive. 
Lois Arena, Steven Winter Associates. Ilana Judah & Daniel Piselli,FXFOWLE Architects. Luke Falk, The Related Companies. New York is synonymous with high-rise building.  To complete New York's low-energy puzzle we need to demystify how we can make high-rises Passive.  This panel will identify obstacles and strategies to make high-rise Passive work for NYC development, including curtain wall and mechanical systems design and construction.

· High Internal Load Buildings Case Study: University of Chicago Field Laboratory.  Matthew O'Malia, Timothy Lock, G-O Logic. High internal load buildings like laboratories pose specific challenges in reaching Passive House performance. Find out how this architect made it happen.

·  Passive House Grows Up: Herz-Lang unlock the world of big buildings. Dieter Herz, Herz-Lang. Passive House is the new baseline for buildings. With Passive House performance in place we can economically fight climate change and deliver energy neutral and energy positive buildings. Real world examples will include a chain of hotels, big non-residential buildings and retrofits of existing buildings. See the assemblies, the systems and the results. Resiliency has never felt so good.

·  Policy, Passive House and a Resilient New York Future. John Lee, NYC Mayor's Office of Sustainability. Laurie Kerr, Urban Green Council. Alex Wilson, Resilient Design Institute. Jessica Grove-Smith, Passive House Institute. Sebastian Moreno-Vacca, A2M. Moderated by Albert Appleton. An exposition and discussion on the role Passive House can and should play in the meeting Mayor de Blasio's 80 x 50 carbon reduction goals and making a more resilient New York. 

The conference is also an Expo of over 30 of the leading component and service providers crucial to making Passive House buildings a reality. These include : 


Platinum Sponsor: Klearwall windows and doors.
Gold Sponsors: Pro Clima, European Architecture Supply and Yaro Windows 
Silver Sponsors: Zehnder America, Steven Winter Associates, Built with Prospect,Cosella Dorken, Logix, NYSERDA, The Association for Energy Affordability, SIGA, PBDW Architects and BuildForward.

AIA HSW continuing education credits will be available to qualified attending professionals.


Find our more and register here.  

The cost is $225 for general admission, $155 for NYPH members (become a NYPH member here), $75 with a student ID.   Register here.
results.name: NY15 Conference and Expo - Built To Last: Passive House.
