results.description:
Punch Winter in the teeth and start your SPRING with Russian Martial Arts!

Do you want to CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter? 


Do you want to INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and expand your combat potential?


Do you want to learn self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE and build  MENTAL FOCUS and PHYSICAL PREPAREDNESS that will carry over into every aspect of your life? 

Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your NEW YEAR with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE. 

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. By mastering and employing the principles of biomechanical movement, selective tension, structural alignment, and active relaxation, you will learn to easily double your striking power, hide your strikes and take-downs within unobtrusive movements, frustrate a skilled grappler, diffuse a violent situation, and escape a panicked or excited crowd. 

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and later codified by the Russian Soviet elite special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity.  Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety. 

Fees 

Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required!  Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083. 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).


When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

It has been a while since last time we were at Sky Room. Before summer is over, let's go back to our favor rooftop lounge for a fun night of party, drinks & meeting new friends.

Sky Room Times Square :: NYC's Highest Rooftop Lounge
Sky Room, which boasts 360 degree views of Manhattan and the Hudson River from the city's highest rooftop lounge, takes New York City nightlife to the next level. Occupying the 33rd and 34th Floor of the newly constructed Fairfield Inn and Suites by Marriott Times Square, the bi-level ultra lounge transports guests to a high energy oasis atop 40th Street and offers five distinct spaces: the Times Square Lounge, the Cube balcony, the Private Salon, the North terrace with its retractable roof, and the South Terrace with its private cabanas.

The north terrace on the 34th floor provides a comfortable environment all year round with a fully retractable glass roof cover and panoramic glass walls, offering stunning views of the Times Square area. One standout highlight of the venue is the South Terrace on the 2nd level, which features illuminated furniture and flush lit floor tiles amidst a lush landscape, set up to offer a luxurious space where guests can truly enjoy being in the heart of Manhattan, with views of the Hudson River and the Empire State Building.

Date & Time: Thursday, June 11th, 2015 (7:00 PM – 10:00 PM)

Location: Shown Above

Cost: FREE admission; Mention Jack at the door for this FREE admission special. 21+ event with photo ID.

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE DON'T HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Braulio )

(Co-leader- Joe A.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

WARNING!  This Is A MANIFESTATION EVENT!  The Love Guru will walk you through wild, wacky and fun exercises that will make your dreams come true!  This is 1 hour dedicated to helping you get what you want out of life!  Get ready.... this is spiritual event like you've never experienced before!

What do you secretly desire?


Has it been a dream you've held close to your heart for a long time?

WHY HASN'T IT COME TRUE?

TELL ME... Which One Are You....?


"THE STRUGGLING WARRIOR"
She or he is working hard, but gets no where fast.
Unfulfilled dreams.
Not satisfied with his or her success.
Hard work, stress and strain...
all you want to do is complain! 

"THE PRAYING WARRIOR" 
He or she knows that God is part of his success, so he or she prays and prays and follows inspiration. Not sure which way to go and his or her dreams are still not manifesting. (Let's hope you don't get exhausted and give up soon! There's a fear you're getting older and don't know what to do) 

"THE WARRIOR OF SUCCESS"
Living his or her dreams.
Rising in career success.
Happy, fulfilled.
A perfect combination of prayer, trust, knowing and being able to see his or her dreams come true!

JOIN ME ON JUNE 11th 2015
and
LEARN HOW TO BE A WARRIOR FOR YOUR DREAMS AND CAREER SUCCESS!

In this 1 hour event, The Love Guru Blaire will share key elements to making your dreams come true and how to be a warrior for your dreams to come true!

Like most of The Love Guru's events, the first 30 minutes will be dedicated to channeled guidance and healing that comes through. The Love Guru is a Spiritual Teacher, Intuitive Heart Healer and Enlightened Master who's psychic and healing gifts have been awakened. She communicates with the angels, guides, ascended masters, archangels and many more in the spiritual realm. In this event, the messages that come through will be specific for those who attend and the energy that wants to come through.

In order to best prepare, have some questions in mind that you would like to be answered. The Love Guru will share what comes through. It may not be what you want to hear, but it will be what your soul needs you to know.

After the 30 minutes of The Love Guru sharing channeled guidance and heart healing work specific to you, it will be your time for your questions and time to interact. The Love Guru's talks are informal and everyone will get personal attention if that is what you desire.

Come with a notepad and pen and take notes. This will be an evening you will want to remember. Guidance, healings and practical exercises will come through on how you can make your dreams come true.


Thursday, June 11th, 2015

7-8PM

Pearl Studios
500 8th Avenue (btw 35/36 streets) 
4th Fl, Studio #410 -- NYC 


MORE INFO:

www.loveguru.net/dreamwarrior


*********************************

GET YOUR TICKET: 

$35 if you pay in advance; $40 the day of.

https://www.paypal.com/us/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_flow&SESSION=2QExd9zN3tVNqBCzi_2KsiBZflGRFSupdMleXymJTG1lwbE0ZbL6Le_82c0&dispatch=50a222a57771920b6a3d7b606239e4d529b525e0b7e69bf0224adecfb0124e9b61f737ba21b08198acc59b45c1b5383c3fbf91319c9514c0

*** Print out your ticket email receipt and bring it to the event to show your purchase. ***   Arrive 15 minutes early to check in, go to the bathroom and get settled.

**********************************


TICKET POLICY:
All tickets must be pre-paid. No cash is accepted at the door. There are no refunds and no exceptions. If you are unable to make the event, you can transfer your ticket to a friend before the day of the event (only) and must email me to let me know who is taking your place before noon.


ABOUT THE LOVE GURU BLAIRE:
The Love Guru has the ability to totally transform your life, bringing in a deeper knowing of YOU, which is accompanied by more peace, happiness, and success. Do you want to upgrade your life? Experience the life that you have been dreaming of for some time? The Love Guru will clear anything that is blocking you from having success and take you to the next level. She has been featured in over 100 press publications, NY Times, Daily News, CNN, MSNBC, LA Times, Glamour Magazine, Montel Show, to name a few. If you would like to become one of The Love Guru's private clients, please contact her at www.loveguru.net

AVAILABLE AT THE EVENT -- ONLY 20!

Blaire's book, "Do You Know My Husband?® The Unexpected Journey Of How The Love Guru Found "The One" will be available for purchase at the event for $20, cash only.  After 10 years -- and during the exact same time frame when my www.marryblaire.com went viral -- Spirit has guided me to release my first book.

MarryBlaire.com was a website Blaire put up in 2004 for friends and family to find her a husband.  She was tired of looking for "The One" and wanted them to do it for her.  Instead of it being a private website, as intended, it went viral.  During that time Blaire blogged about her journey and the insights and guidance she was receiving from The Universe on how to date in an easier, more natural way.  Not only did she receive transformation, but those reading her journey went through transformation with their love lives as well (many of them got married!).  The book has loads of dating and relationship advice and there's extended Q&A in the back of the book as a bonus.

We will have one station hooked up to a projector for presenting materials. I encourage you all to bring your images, before & afters, layered files, etc., so that we may review and critique them.


If anyone has something in particular they are interested in discussing, please send me an email about it and I'll do my best to prep for it. Bring your questions, people!

Please be aware when you RSVP that if you say you will be in attendance, and then do NOT show up– WITHOUT updating your RSVP to reflect your inability to attend– you will be fined $10. If you are a no-show (meaning you say you'll attend and don't show up without changing your RSVP) three times, you will be dismissed from the group.

Too often parodied or reduced to burlesque, belly dancing is actually one of the worlds' oldest dance styles incorporating elements not only from the Middle East, but also from Romani (Gypsy,) Spanish and North African dance traditions.

Gina, a modern Eyptian belly dancer, transport guests on a magical journey through the Middle East.

We are thrilled to have Robin Chase, co-founder of Zipcar, come and present her new book PEERS, INC - How People and Platforms are Inventing the Collaborative Economy and Reinventing Capitalism.

Robin is a visionary and a wonderful, incredible speaker.

The book places collaborative platforms, companies, creators, and participants, as part of an important and pervasive economic phenomenon that is much larger than just the sharing economy.

Come and hear directly from the author and see her book on Amazon

Robin Chase is founder and former CEO of Zipcar, the largest carsharing company in the world; and Buzzcar, p2p carsharing in France (recently merged with Drivy); She is also Executive Chairman of Veniam, a vehicle communications company building the networking fabric for the Internet of Moving Things.

She is one of Time 100 Most Influential People, Fast Company Fast 50 Innovators, and BusinessWeek Top 10 Designers.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
This course is a companion to the "Intro to Arduino".  In this 2-hour session you will  go from programming simple operations to operations of moderate complexity.  No prior programming experience is necessary.  Students with extensive programming experience in other languages may be given special projects to work on and demonstrate to the class at the end of the session

Reviews from our previous courses:

• "Awesome! I'd definitely go to a follow-up."

• "Great workshop, just the right touch to whet my appetite."

Requirements

We ask that participants bring a laptop, and that they have the Arduino software (version 1.6.1 or later) pre-loaded on their computer (http://arduino.cc/en/main/software).  If you need help with this, please let us know prior to the course (send an email to [masked]). We will have Arduinos and Arduino kits available for you to use and/or purchase.

About The Rockland County Makerspace and CILK119


This course is hosted by the Rockland County Makerspace @CILK119 (www.cilk119.com), a co-working space located in Nanuet, NY.  

Dr. Duncan Bell is a life-long tinkerer who graduated from making go-karts and skateboards to designing industrial robots that support pharmaceutical research. Along the way he earned a PhD in Botany and Biophysics and conducted research in Scotland, Italy, and the United States in photosynthesis, cancer, and arthritis. In addition to spreading the word about the fantastic capabilities of the current generation of microcontrollers, he heads up a small company that develops custom storefront displays with coordinated motion and lighting—all driven by Arduinos. Recently, his Arduino-based float was a prize winner at the Nyack Halloween parade and his Persistence of Vision special effect was featured in Elmwood Playhouse’s recent production of “Sunday in the Park with George.” 

Attendees at a recent Arduino Course

Requirements

• Students should also bring a laptop computer with the latest Arduino software installed (http://arduino.cc/en/main/software). If you do not have a computer available, please contact us so that we can make arrangements.

• We have enough Arduinos for participants to use during the class, but we also have Arduinos and Arduino experimentation kits for sale.

results.name: Programming the Arduino

results.description:
http://www.amazon.com/The-Circle-Dave-Eggers/dp/0345807294

Hi All!

Let's celebrate summer with a discussion of "The Circle" by Dave Eggers. Description below. See you on June 11th!

-Kiran

The Circle (from Amazon.com)

http://www.amazon.com/The-Circle-Dave-Eggers/dp/0345807294


When Mae Holland is hired to work for the Circle, the world’s most powerful internet company, she feels she’s been given the opportunity of a lifetime. The Circle, run out of a sprawling California campus, links users’ personal emails, social media, banking, and purchasing with their universal operating system, resulting in one online identity and a new age of civility and transparency. As Mae tours the open-plan office spaces, the towering glass dining facilities, the cozy dorms for those who spend nights at work, she is thrilled with the company’s modernity and activity. There are parties that last through the night, there are famous musicians playing on the lawn, there are athletic activities and clubs and brunches, and even an aquarium of rare fish retrieved from the Marianas Trench by the CEO. Mae can’t believe her luck, her great fortune to work for the most influential company in the world—even as life beyond the campus grows distant, even as a strange encounter with a colleague leaves her shaken, even as her role at the Circle becomes increasingly public. What begins as the captivating story of one woman’s ambition and idealism soon becomes a heart-racing novel of suspense, raising questions about memory, history, privacy, democracy, and the limits of human knowledge.

results.name: Book Discussion: The Circle by Dave Eggers

Join us for a night of eclectic entertainment, freegan food and relaxing company.


Can you sing? Play an instrument? Rap? Tell a joke? Share a story? Or teach a cool DIY (do it yourself/life hack)?  Can you juggle? Perform a monologue or dialogue?  Dance? Contort? Lead a game? Recite a poem (original or not)?


"Performers" should try to have an "act" that can be as short as 1 minute or as long as 6 minutes.  (if your act is longer than 6 minutes, we might be able to accommodate splitting it into two segments).

We will also welcome costumes and have a freegan fashion show.

If you would like to be part of the program of performers, please email Janet at [masked] as soon as possible so we can work out a set list.


Of course, no show would be complete without an audience -- feel free to come and enjoy the food and festivities without performing.

We hope to have time for an Open Mic segment and anyone in the audience will be welcome to participate.


Doors will open at 6pm. We'll start with an hour of mingling and refreshments until 7pm. The show should start shortly after 7pm and finish at 9pm.


If you arrive at an event and cannot find us, call Janet at (347)[masked] (no texts please).

results.description:
What are the connections between being an artist, musician, designer and software developer? How do creative skills and processes connect to technology? Can coding be creative and can code create fine art? 

Join Dev Bootcamp for an engaging discussion with creative coders: individuals who converted their creative careers into careers in technology and artists who are inspired by and utilize programming, code and software to create their works of art. Panelists will discuss their backgrounds, share their creative work, and discuss how it connects to their careers in technology and how technology drives their creative process. 

Light refreshments will be served.

The panel features: 

Kelani Nichole: Digital product strategist and researcher, Director of Transfer gallery with a curatorial specialty in networked practice. See more of her work at http://kelaninichole.com/

Ashley Zelinskie: Brooklyn-based artist designing work designed to be appreciated by both human and computer. See more of her work at http://www.ashleyzelinskie.com/

Anthony Cangelosi: Senior Interaction Designer at Shapeways and drummer in Justice of the Unicorns

Michael Angelo: Software engineer at Waywire Networks, Dev Bootcamp graduate and professional opera singer

Moderated by Liz Flyntz, independent curator and UI/UX designer at Series Digital. See more of her work at http://www.lizflyntz.net/

Panelist Bios: 

Kelani Nichole is an independent digital strategist, user-centered design specialist and curator working at the intersection of Art + Techonology. She is co-founder of TRANSFER, an exhibition space that explores the friction of networked contemporary practice and its physical instantiation. Nichole has over a decade of expertise designing delightful experiences for clients across industries including startups, fine arts, non-profits, education, retail, finance and B2B service providers. 

Ashley Zelinskie is an artist based in Brooklyn, N.Y. Her work blurs the lines between art and technology, and spans a variety of media from sculpture to computer programs. After receiving a degree in glass from the Rhode Island School of Design, Ashley began to experiment with the pairing of artistic media and technology. The work she creates now is designed to be appreciated by both human and computer.


Anthony Cangelosi is a musician and the Senior Interaction Designer at Shapeways, a 3D printing service and marketplace. He's a self taught front-end coder who believes that you should be able to build what you design. He plays drums in his band Justice of the Unicorns, but only if there's free beer.


Michael Angelo is FullStack Web Developer he is committed to making beautiful creations, that are exciting and functional. He considers himself to be extremely passionate about Web Development and believes that attention to detail as well as simplistic and clean UI is often the key to a great product.  

Liz Flyntz is a curator, writer, and designer at Series Digital.  Her research focuses on the intersections of historic and contemporary media art, artist-produced alternative funding models, and systems-based art.  She’s currently working on an exhibition focussing on the time capsules produced by radical media and architectural group Ant Farm, to take place at Pioneer Works, Brooklyn in 2016.  In 2012 she completed an MFA in Media Study, with a concentration in Emerging Practices at the State University of New York at Buffalo and she received her BA from Antioch College in Yellow Springs, OH.

About Dev Bootcamp:

Dev Bootcamp pioneered the short-term immersive “bootcamp” model which transforms beginners into full-stack web developers. With campuses in San Francisco, New York City and Chicago, our 19-week curriculum (9 week part-time remote + 9 week on-campus immersive + Career Week) focuses on Ruby, Javascript, Rails, SQL, HTML and CSS, as well as pair programming, agile and test driven development. To date we’ve graduated more than 1,400 alumni who energize development teams all over the world. For more information, visit Devbootcamp.com or sign up for a tour of our New York campus.

Questions? Email [masked]
results.name: Creative Coders: Making Work at the Intersection of Art and Technology

results.description:
Introduction into the discounted Note Business

The Note Business is simple. The discounted note market begins with a lender selling a pool of Notes at a discount.  It is more cost effective to package notes and sell them for cash than to hire additional staff and create workouts over time.

The discounted note business is a learn by doing business. Every homeowner situation is unique and relevant.  First you must understand the business and then you will be able to create and earn passive income for now or retirement.

Attend this Introduction into the Note Business Session to learn the following:

1) Understand Key Terms

2) How to Find Deals

3) Evaluate & Buy

4) How to exit the deal

5) How to create passive income

There are unlimited possibilities in notes to make quick cash, monthly income, and build long term wealth.

Our goal in the group is to build a note community by teaching investors how to capitalize on the foreclosure crisis by buying discounted notes for pennies on the dollar.

Purchasing discounted notes is another alternative to buying foreclosure or owning rental properties.

results.description:
Hi THERE!

At this meetup we will be doing exercises to strengthen many of the muscles that help us to be stronger runners.  We will NOT be running the loop at this meetup. 

Exercises will consist of stationary exercises as well as running drills.

I hope you can make it!  Please read the information below. Thanks :)

____________________________________________________


To improve your running it is ESSENTIAL that you do other exercises.

One of the most important areas to strengthen are the HIPS.  Weak hips create weak knees, weak ankles and lead to injuries.

1. Add hip strengthening to your training


All coaches would agree that staying healthy and training consistently are the primary keys to success. If you can train healthy for months and years at a time you will improve – it’s one of the only guarantees in running.

The problem is actually staying healthy.

When research estimates that nearly 72% of runners will get injured sometime in their running career, how can you avoid being part of this statistic and actually run injury-free?

The easiest and simplest way is to strengthen the areas that are most likely to lead to injury. In running, that’s the hips.

Research clearly identifies weakness and tightness in the hips as the primary cause for almost all knee injuries (including IT band) as well as a secondary contributor to injuries such as plantar fasciitis and achilles tendonitis.

So, we know that strengthening the hips will greatly reduce the likelihood of running injuries.

____________________________________________________

Satisfy your appetite to meet fun new people with our famous Rotating Group Dinners.  First enjoy casual conversations then you will be randomly seated at the table for our group dinner.  After each course of the meal you will be randomly directed to a new seat!  It is a fun way to meet others in the group as you wind up sitting with different combinations of people throughout the dinner.  It is fun, goofy and very effective at creating great connections.  The restaurant itself is nothing to look at but the food makes up for the lack of atmosphere!  We have hosted dozens of great dinners there.  

The meal will include: Soup, Choice of appetizer, choice of entree, Nan bread, basmati rice, dessert and free flowing wine!

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up Group reflect only a portion of those attending. DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU WILL ACTUALLY COME. If you have any questions including how many we will have total contact the organizer directly at [masked]. We normally have 15-20 attending.

Satisfy your appetite to meet fun new people with our famous Rotating Group Dinners.  First enjoy casual conversations then you will be randomly seated at the table for our group dinner.  After each course of the meal you will be randomly directed to a new seat!  It is a fun way to meet others in the group as you wind up sitting with different combinations of people throughout the dinner.  It is fun, goofy and very effective at creating great connections.  The restaurant itself is nothing to look at but the food makes up for the lack of atmosphere!  We have hosted dozens of great dinners there.  

The meal will include: Soup, Choice of appetizer, choice of entree, Nan bread, basmati rice, dessert and free flowing wine!

Appetizer:  Samosa (meat, veg or coconut)

Entree's Include:

Chicken, Lamb, Veg or Beef:  (Curry, Korma, Malai, Sag, Dhansak, Madras, Shree Mangol, Dilder, Bhuna, Doplaza Okra Masala ).

Chicken Tandori,

Chicken Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken, Chicken Makhni

Sag Paneer, Malai Kofta, Mutter Paneer, Aldo Chana Masala, Kashmiri Eggplant, Okra Sag, Mushroom Sag, Aloo Palak, Chana Palak,

Biryani-Chicken/Lamb/Beef Veg

Salmon or Shrimp (Curry, Korma, Malai, Madras, Vindaloo)


$30 includes: full meal, tax, tip and free flowing wine! (Please bring exact change)

What to wear: business casual/comfortable

What to expect: 12-16 fun and friendly people

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending sign up on their own.

Is the food spicy? You can ask for mild versions of many dishes.

This event is being sponsored by  WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM  and several Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP’s below reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions, please contact Dave Cervini at [masked] or call[masked]-2256. Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending. (We have a 3 flakes and you’re out rule).

Age range - (Women 35 - 48, Men 21 - 33)

This speed dating event is for older women and younger men. If you are a woman who is looking for a younger, more energetic man then this event is for you! And if you are a man looking for an attractive older woman with experience, then your search stops here! We expect up to 10 men and 10 women to participate, and each date will be for 5 minutes. You will get your match results the next day! 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

In addition, you will make pomodoro ripieni (stuffed tomatoes) and mascarpone tart with fresh berries. Yes, you will make the pastry too! Wine with dinner included. Join the group and make these dishes part of your favorite go to dinner!

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
